descriptionHTML:
We help the world run better


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


What you’ll do


Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Software Developer


Location: Vancouver, BC


Expected Start Date: April 2024


Contract Duration: 8 months


Work Hours: 40 hours per week


SAP Concur is the world’s leading brand for integrated travel, expense, and invoice management solutions, driven by a relentless pursuit to simplify and automate these everyday processes. The Travel Platform team at SAP Concur is seeking a highly motivated and energetic software developer to assist in building our next-gen travel platform. We are building the new travel admin configuration platform which will be used by all clients with an admin role, to configure various features across the SAP Concur site.


What you bring


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


Position Requirements:

  • Understanding of software applications, software development lifecycle, and development methodologies (Agile/Scrum)
  • Strong programming skills and experience with object-oriented languages such as Java
  • Strong proficiency in front-end development languages (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
  • Flexibility to work with a global team in various time zones
  • Clear and concise communication, both verbal and written
  • Strong desire to interact with and learn from senior members of the team

Nice to Have:

  • JavaScript framework (React+Redux) experience preferred
  • Java framework (Spring Boot) experience preferred
  • DevOps experience preferred
  • Experience with databases (PostgreSQL) preferred
  • UI Unit and/or E2E Testing experience preferred
  • Familiarity with development tools such as Git and JIRA

Educational requirements:

  • Currently studying or have recently completed an undergraduate or graduate program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, or Information Systems


Meet your team


We are a full-stack development team. We use React, Node.js and Redux for Web UI development and our backend services are using SpringBoot. We also manage CI/CD pipelines for our services using Kubernetes and Docker. In addition to these technical skills, you will get to work in a highly collaborative environment using agile software development methodologies. Our team is distributed across multiple cities in the US.


We build breakthroughs together


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.


We win with inclusion


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.


EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 24-40 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to appliable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by clicking this link: SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com

description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  
 
  Job description
 
 
 
   Who we are?
 
 
  
    Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and is dedicated to helping healthcare professionals perform their jobs more efficiently while enhancing patient care. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. We are currently seeking a Software Test Engineer, Co-Op to join Stryker Endoscopy’s Test team located in Burnaby, Canada.
  
  
    What we do?
  
  
    We partner closely with R&D to experiment with early prototypes and vet product designs throughout the design process. You will be responsible for design verification: from developing and maintaining test protocols, and test execution to documenting results in test reports that are included in regulatory submissions. Communication and coordination are essential skills as you will share and/or coordinate samples, test execution, and test results with the team lead.
  
  
    What you will do?
  
  
   
     Demonstrated knowledge of understanding the Software test discipline.
   
  
 
 
  
   
     Applies engineering judgement in a subset of their area to root cause defects and develop test methods.
     Develops repeatable test methods of simple complexity for a well-defined requirement.
     Has a high-level understanding of the functionality of the product(s).
     Gathers feedback from users and technical leaders during test protocol development.
     Demonstrates high level of understanding on the Design Controls, regulatory standards and guidance applicable to specific test protocols.
   
  
 
 
  
   
     Responsible for performing test execution and developing test results following Good Documentation Practices (GDP)
     Regularly updates Test Lead and/or Functional Manager with status of tasks.
   
  
  
  
    What we need:
  
  
   
     Working towards Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) in Computer Science (or other related) and/or Electrical Engineering with 0-4 years of previous technical experience
   
  
 
 
  
   
     Excellent analytical skills
     Exhibit initiative, dependability, independence, motivation, and be detail-oriented
   
  
  
  
    Work from Home: Occasional
  
  
    Travel Percentage: 20%
  
 
 
 
   Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.
 
 
   Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.
 
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
  The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team


Job description


Who we are?

Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and is dedicated to helping healthcare professionals perform their jobs more efficiently while enhancing patient care. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. We are currently seeking a Software Test Engineer, Co-Op to join Stryker Endoscopy’s Test team located in Burnaby, Canada.

What we do?

We partner closely with R&D to experiment with early prototypes and vet product designs throughout the design process. You will be responsible for design verification: from developing and maintaining test protocols, and test execution to documenting results in test reports that are included in regulatory submissions. Communication and coordination are essential skills as you will share and/or coordinate samples, test execution, and test results with the team lead.

What you will do?

  • Demonstrated knowledge of understanding the Software test discipline.

  • Applies engineering judgement in a subset of their area to root cause defects and develop test methods.

  • Develops repeatable test methods of simple complexity for a well-defined requirement.

  • Has a high-level understanding of the functionality of the product(s).

  • Gathers feedback from users and technical leaders during test protocol development.

  • Demonstrates high level of understanding on the Design Controls, regulatory standards and guidance applicable to specific test protocols.

  • Responsible for performing test execution and developing test results following Good Documentation Practices (GDP)

  • Regularly updates Test Lead and/or Functional Manager with status of tasks.


What we need:

  • Working towards Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) in Computer Science (or other related) and/or Electrical Engineering with 0-4 years of previous technical experience

  • Excellent analytical skills

  • Exhibit initiative, dependability, independence, motivation, and be detail-oriented


Work from Home: Occasional

Travel Percentage: 20%


Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.

Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.


About Stryker

Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.

The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.

More information is available at stryker.com

description:
Job description
Seeking full-time or part-time Registered Clinical Counsellors or Canadian Certified Counsellors to provide counselling to individuals and couples. In this position, you are an independent contractor offering primarily in-person sessions with some virtual available.
About Us
Better Life Counselling & Therapy is a subsidiary of A Better Life Through Psychotherapy and Healing which was established in 1995 with the goal of providing accessible, effective counselling to individuals and families. Over the past 25 + years, we have successfully helped hundreds of families, parents, children and couples accomplish their goals of experiencing themselves as more connected, alive and free .
Our office is conveniently located off of the Brunette Exit.
Our Vision
We help thousands of people learn to live better lives with vitality and connection.
Our Core Values
Authenticity, Genuineness & Dignity
Be a Team Player
Work Hard, Play Hard
There are many different shifts available including: M-F 9am-3 pm; 3-9pm, weekends
The position is quite flexible and we can work with you to create a dream job!
By joining our team you will be provided with:

 Competitive compensation (based on experience)
 Referrals from a Waiting List
 Optional group and on-call peer consultation
 Optional professional development in Satir Family Systems with Master Trainer
 Professional office space
 Conveniently located just off Hwy #1/Brunette Ave

Qualifications

 The ideal candidate has a Masters degree and is Registered with the British Columbia Association of Clinical Counsellors or Canadian Counselling and Psychotherapy Association. You have or are planning to acquire EMDR training and approval from EMDRIA, Somatic Experiencing/ Attachment Psychotherapy and/or you have or are planning to acquire professional development training for working with couples (examples: Gottman, EFT, IFS for couples)

Application Process:

 Please send in your resume and cover letter to: betterlifecounsellingtherapy@gmail.com

For more info on our practice, check out our website: https://betterlifecounsellingtherapy.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
COWI is a leading consulting group that creates value for customers, people and society through our unique 360° approach. Based on our world-class competencies within engineering, economics and environmental science, we tackle challenges from many vantage points to create coherent solutions for our customer.
With offices across the globe, we combine global presence with local knowledge to take on projects anywhere in the world - no matter how large or small. At any given moment, we are involved in more than 12,000 projects.

At COWI, we take pride in employees who are curious about new technologies and ways to cooperate to deliver future-oriented solutions to our customers. And we believe that you develop best by participating in projects that challenge your knowledge.

We cooperate across disciplines, customer portfolios and business units all over the world. As an employee in COWI, an international career is within your reach. By working on our global projects, you can develop sustainable solutions from Africa to Europe and from Asia to America.

We have nearly 90 years of experience in the business, and COWI is a leader within its field because our 7,300 employees are leaders within theirs. Together, we create coherence in tomorrow's sustainable societies.

Join us and expand your potential!
description:
Application deadline: 23 March 2024 - Canada - Location: North Vancouver, BC - Infrastructure & Transportation 
 
  Stagiaire en ingénieurie ponts et ouvrages d'art 
  North Vancouver
   Temporaire
   Voulez-vous faire partie d'une équipe d’experts internationale et travailler sous la supervision d'un ingénieur professionnel? Pouvez-vous aider une équipe hautement professionnelle qui fournit des services de génie-conseil, de gestion de projet, d’ingénierie détaillée et de suivi de construction sur de nombreux projets de conception de ponts complexes? Si c'est le cas, c'est votre chance de convertir vos aspirations en actions.
   Transformer les défis en solutions durables
   Nous sommes à la recherche d’un stagiaire en ingénierie en ponts et ouvrages d'art pour joindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec une équipe d’experts aux côtés de nos clients sur certains projets des plus importants d'Amérique du Nord. Avec nos clients, partenaires et collègues, nous façonnons un avenir où les personnes et les sociétés grandissent et s’épanouissent. Pour ce faire, nous co-créons des solutions durables et esthétiques qui améliorent la qualité de vie des gens d’aujourd’hui et des générations à venir.
   Vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :
  
   
     Aider à préparer des plans et autres documents d’ingénierie en français
   
   
     Effectuer des inspections de ponts et autres structures
   
   
     Aider à préparer des rapports d’inspection et autres documents techniques
   
   
     Appliquer des articles de code de conception aux tâches d’ingénierie assignées sous supervision
   
   
     Communiquer efficacement et professionnellement avec les membres de l’équipe
   
   
     Assister aux réunions de projet et fournir une mise à jour sur les tâches assignées
   
  
   Vos compétences. Notre équipe. Ensemble, nous concevons l’avenir
   La première étape vers le succès dans ce rôle est d’être désireux de collaborer avec les personnes qui vous entourent. Développer des liens avec les autres est quelque chose que vous faites en agissant avec respect et en tenant vos engagements. Et vous ne restez pas ancré dans vos habitudes, mais continuez à explorer de nouvelles idées et de nouvelles façons de vous améliorer.
   En plus de cela, vous êtes:
  
   
     Vous maîtrisez le français et l’anglais
   
   
     Vous être inscrit(e)s dans un programme d’ingénierie civil ou en structure et vous avez complété au moins les deux premières années du programme
   
   
     Vous êtes disponibles pour un stage d’au moins huit mois
   
   
     Vous avez une bonne connaissance des logiciels d’ingénierie tels qu’Excel pour produire efficacement des calculs d’ingénierie
   
   
     Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en communication interpersonnelle, verbale et écrite
   
   
     Titulaire d'un permis de conduire de classe 5
   
   
     Vous pouvez et vous avez la volonté de voyager pour mener des inspections qui peuvent durer une semaine ou plus
   
  
   SVP veuillez déposer votre candidature en anglais.
   Encore des questions?
   Si vous avez des questions sans réponse sur le rôle ou ce que nous avons à offrir, veuillez contacter l’administrateur de l’acquisition de talents Mehul Jain à l’adresse MHJI@COWI.COM.
   Apprenez à mieux nous connaître sur notre site internet, www.cowi.com , où vous pouvez en apprendre davantage sur nos projets, notre stratégie, ce que nous voulons réaliser et à quoi ressemble la vie chez COWI.
   Employeur de l’égalité d’accès
   COWI offre l'égalité de l'accès à l’emploi (EAE) à tous les employés et candidats à l’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’origine, l’âge, le handicap ou la génétique. En plus des exigences de la loi fédérale, COWI se conforme aux lois fédérales et locales applicables régissant la non-discrimination dans l’emploi partout où l’entreprise a des installations. Cette pratique s’applique à toutes les conditions d’emploi, y compris le recrutement, l’embauche, le placement, la promotion, la cessation d’emploi, la mise à pied, le rappel, la mutation, les congés, la rémunération et la formation.
   Bridge Intern 
  North Vancouver
   Temporary
   Do you want to join a global team of experts and work under the guidance of professional engineers? Can you assist a highly professional team that provides consulting, project management, and design and construction engineering services on numerous complex bridge design projects? Then, here is your chance to convert aspirations into actions.
   Turn challenges into sustainable solutions
   We are looking for a Bridge Intern to join our team. You will work closely with a team of experts working alongside our customers on some of North America's most significant projects. Together with customers, partners, and colleagues, we shape a future where people and societies grow and flourish. We do that by co-creating sustainable and beautiful solutions that improve the quality of life for people today and many generations ahead.
   
  Your key responsibilities will be to: 
  
   
    Assist in preparing drawings and other engineering documents in French
   
   
     Perform inspections of bridges and other structures
   
   
     Assist in preparing inspection reports and other technical documents
   
   
     Apply design code clauses to engineering tasks assigned under supervision
   
   
     Communicate effectively and professionally with team members
   
   
     Attend project meetings and provide updates on assigned tasks
   
  
   Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future
   The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.
   On top of that, you will:
  
   
     Have fluency in both French and English
   
   
     Be enrolled in Civil or Structural Engineering and have completed at least two years in the program
   
   
     Be available for an 8 month work term
   
   
     Be conversant in the use of engineering software such as Excel to efficiently produce engineering calculations
   
   
     Have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
   
   
     Possess a Class 5 driver's licence
   
   
     Have the ability and willingness to go on inspection trips that may have a duration of one week or more
   
  
   Got more questions?
   If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Administrator Mehul at mhji@COWI.COM.
   Base compensation: $49,000 to $67,000 for North Vancouver location only. Actual compensation is subject to variations due to education, experience, skill set and/or location
   Equal opportunity employer
   COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

descriptionHTML:
Application deadline: 23 March 2024 - Canada - Location: North Vancouver, BC - Infrastructure & Transportation

Stagiaire en ingénieurie ponts et ouvrages d'art

North Vancouver

Temporaire

Voulez-vous faire partie d'une équipe d’experts internationale et travailler sous la supervision d'un ingénieur professionnel? Pouvez-vous aider une équipe hautement professionnelle qui fournit des services de génie-conseil, de gestion de projet, d’ingénierie détaillée et de suivi de construction sur de nombreux projets de conception de ponts complexes? Si c'est le cas, c'est votre chance de convertir vos aspirations en actions.

Transformer les défis en solutions durables

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un stagiaire en ingénierie en ponts et ouvrages d'art pour joindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec une équipe d’experts aux côtés de nos clients sur certains projets des plus importants d'Amérique du Nord. Avec nos clients, partenaires et collègues, nous façonnons un avenir où les personnes et les sociétés grandissent et s’épanouissent. Pour ce faire, nous co-créons des solutions durables et esthétiques qui améliorent la qualité de vie des gens d’aujourd’hui et des générations à venir.

Vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :

    Aider à préparer des plans et autres documents d’ingénierie en français
    Effectuer des inspections de ponts et autres structures
    Aider à préparer des rapports d’inspection et autres documents techniques
    Appliquer des articles de code de conception aux tâches d’ingénierie assignées sous supervision
    Communiquer efficacement et professionnellement avec les membres de l’équipe
    Assister aux réunions de projet et fournir une mise à jour sur les tâches assignées

Vos compétences. Notre équipe. Ensemble, nous concevons l’avenir

La première étape vers le succès dans ce rôle est d’être désireux de collaborer avec les personnes qui vous entourent. Développer des liens avec les autres est quelque chose que vous faites en agissant avec respect et en tenant vos engagements. Et vous ne restez pas ancré dans vos habitudes, mais continuez à explorer de nouvelles idées et de nouvelles façons de vous améliorer.

En plus de cela, vous êtes:

    Vous maîtrisez le français et l’anglais
    Vous être inscrit(e)s dans un programme d’ingénierie civil ou en structure et vous avez complété au moins les deux premières années du programme
    Vous êtes disponibles pour un stage d’au moins huit mois
    Vous avez une bonne connaissance des logiciels d’ingénierie tels qu’Excel pour produire efficacement des calculs d’ingénierie
    Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en communication interpersonnelle, verbale et écrite
    Titulaire d'un permis de conduire de classe 5
    Vous pouvez et vous avez la volonté de voyager pour mener des inspections qui peuvent durer une semaine ou plus

SVP veuillez déposer votre candidature en anglais.

Encore des questions?

Si vous avez des questions sans réponse sur le rôle ou ce que nous avons à offrir, veuillez contacter l’administrateur de l’acquisition de talents Mehul Jain à l’adresse MHJI@COWI.COM.

Apprenez à mieux nous connaître sur notre site internet, www.cowi.com , où vous pouvez en apprendre davantage sur nos projets, notre stratégie, ce que nous voulons réaliser et à quoi ressemble la vie chez COWI.

Employeur de l’égalité d’accès

COWI offre l'égalité de l'accès à l’emploi (EAE) à tous les employés et candidats à l’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’origine, l’âge, le handicap ou la génétique. En plus des exigences de la loi fédérale, COWI se conforme aux lois fédérales et locales applicables régissant la non-discrimination dans l’emploi partout où l’entreprise a des installations. Cette pratique s’applique à toutes les conditions d’emploi, y compris le recrutement, l’embauche, le placement, la promotion, la cessation d’emploi, la mise à pied, le rappel, la mutation, les congés, la rémunération et la formation.

Bridge Intern

North Vancouver

Temporary

Do you want to join a global team of experts and work under the guidance of professional engineers? Can you assist a highly professional team that provides consulting, project management, and design and construction engineering services on numerous complex bridge design projects? Then, here is your chance to convert aspirations into actions.

Turn challenges into sustainable solutions

We are looking for a Bridge Intern to join our team. You will work closely with a team of experts working alongside our customers on some of North America's most significant projects. Together with customers, partners, and colleagues, we shape a future where people and societies grow and flourish. We do that by co-creating sustainable and beautiful solutions that improve the quality of life for people today and many generations ahead.


Your key responsibilities will be to:

    Assist in preparing drawings and other engineering documents in French
    Perform inspections of bridges and other structures
    Assist in preparing inspection reports and other technical documents
    Apply design code clauses to engineering tasks assigned under supervision
    Communicate effectively and professionally with team members
    Attend project meetings and provide updates on assigned tasks

Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future


The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.

On top of that, you will:

    Have fluency in both French and English
    Be enrolled in Civil or Structural Engineering and have completed at least two years in the program
    Be available for an 8 month work term
    Be conversant in the use of engineering software such as Excel to efficiently produce engineering calculations
    Have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
    Possess a Class 5 driver's licence
    Have the ability and willingness to go on inspection trips that may have a duration of one week or more

Got more questions?

If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Administrator Mehul at mhji@COWI.COM.


Base compensation: $49,000 to $67,000 for North Vancouver location only. Actual compensation is subject to variations due to education, experience, skill set and/or location

Equal opportunity employer

COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

#LI-MHJI

description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  
 BASIC FUNCTION
 
  This role will support the systems team with cross-disciplinary solutions for an Endoscopy product.
  It will be a mix of design/testing (40%), and technical writing/meetings/quality management system
  development (60%).
  
 
  This 8-month co-op term is preferably aimed at applicants in their 3rd or 4th year of a Biomedical, Electrical,
  Integrated, Mechatronics (or similar) program. It would be advantageous to have completed a previous co-op
  term.
  
 
  This position is not a remote only position, it may be hybrid depending upon the nature of projects.
  This position provides an opportunity to learn about the design requirements of medical devices and how to
  define product and platform them, with the successful applicant participating in activities including writing
  requirements, designing test fixtures or tools, and prototyping.
 
  RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  Primarily: assisting with the design of various aspects of an Endoscopy product offering.
  Evaluating design options and bench testing to determine acceptability criteria and optimal solutions given
  constrained timelines.
  
 
  Providing progress updates in design reviews as required.
  Supporting prototyping and new product development.
  Designing and building test fixtures and jigs in support of verification and product testing, as needed.
  Producing DHF documentation such as requirements, protocols and test reports.
  Additional responsibilities may include assisting in assembly of prototype devices, development of optomechanical
  jigs & fixtures, research on injection molding methods & materials, and supporting the project
  manager as required.
  GENERAL:
  While working with a team of engineers and under the supervision of a senior engineer, the co-op will be
  expected to engage on some of the following types of activities:
  
 
  Quality Management System DHF/DMR development on new and existing products, including documentation,
  meetings, and liaising across cross-functional teams.
  
 
  Participate in front-end conceptual design and engineering activities on new products.
  Sourcing components and identifying appropriate vendors.
  Product and component testing both in the form of early laboratory prototypes and final, formal product
  verification testing.
  
 
  Design of test setups and testing conditions to investigate options for improving device performance.
  May work with vendor engineers to design systems, and during early design stages to perform evaluations
  and experiments.
  
 
  Participate in design reviews, risk management and associated risk control assessment.
  Understand and follow proper procedures and best practices; work with senior engineers to improve them.
  Actively contribute to and respect team decisions; strive for and abide by consensus; operate within Company
  core values.
  
 
  Contribute to project planning and commit to deliverable goals. Proactively report progress to project
  management and R&D management when required.
  
 
  Take direction as needed from senior engineers and R&D managers; complete most tasks with minimal
  guidance; use resources responsibly and effectively.
  
 
  Proactively seek out senior technical leaders and managers as necessary.
 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS
 
   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
   
  
   Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 kilograms of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force
   frequently to lift, carry, etc. generally involves sitting most of the time.
   
  
   Must be able to communicate with groups of people.
   Must be able to review printed materials.
   Ability to use common office equipment.
   MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
   
  
   Self-managed, self-motivated, with excellent hands-on problem-solving skills.
   Must be able to generate and explain design objectives.
   Must be able to complete detailed documentation accurately. Astute attention to detail.
   Must demonstrate creative thinking and paper-based problem-solving ability.
   Must be able to review and troubleshoot designs and provide constructive feedback. Listens to others within
   the team environment to understand their thinking.
   SKILLS/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
   
  
   Self-managed and self-motivated work ethic is critical given the nature of position (some remote work, largely
   without constant oversight)
   
  
   Hands-on problem-solving skills
   Fluent with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, etc.).
   Experience in any CAD modeling software.
   Experience in programming and basic of SDLC
   Debugging skills on basic EE, SW and Assembly
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
   Proven ability to write procedures and present complex problems and solutions.
   EDUCATION/TRAINING REQUIRED
   
  
   Enrolled in an engineering program – preferably 3rd or 4th year of an Engineering program (EE, Biomedical,
   Integrated, Biomechanics, or similar)
   
  
   Available for an 8-month co-op term at minimum
  
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
  The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
À PROPOS DE FPINNOVATIONS 

FPInnovations est un organisme sans but lucratif qui se spécialise dans la création de solutions afin de soutenir la compétitivité du secteur forestier canadien à l’échelle mondiale. L’organisme jouit d’une position idéale pour effectuer de la recherche de pointe, concevoir des technologies avancées et offrir des solutions novatrices à des problèmes complexes, et ce, à chaque élément de la chaîne des valeurs du secteur, des opérations forestières aux produits industriels et de consommation.

 
ABOUT FPINNOVATIONS

FPInnovations is a private not-for-profit organization that specializes in the creation of solutions in support of the Canadian forest sector’s global competitiveness. It is ideally positioned to perform state-of-the-art research, develop advanced technologies, and deliver innovative solutions to complex problems for every area of the sector’s value chain, from forest operations to consumer and industrial products.
description:
At FPInnovations, we don't just offer jobs, we offer career opportunities that will allow you to significantly contribute to the Canadian forest industry. We rely on the outstanding expertise of over 330 employees to support our member companies and the industry.
     
      You can look forward to:
     
       An organization in the midst of a transformation that focuses on agility and innovation
       Working with dedicated and passionate people
       Support in achieving your professional goals
       Hybrid telework policy when possible
       Monday to Friday work week with flexible scheduling options (may require travel on weekends)
     
     
     
       RESPONSIBILITIES
       ThE intern is expected to support multiple projects in the Wood Manufacturing Innovation Centre of Excellence (ICE) in Vancouver, BC including the following projects and responsibilities:
     
     
     
      
        Debarker Optimization
       
         Organize/label/segment log images for debarker optimization
         Write python or Matlab script for pre-processing images
         Help make an inventory of our sensors and electronics, locations, manual, etc (Includes cameras, lasers, NIR, x-ray, etc.)
         Assist in commercialization work for Drylog Detection System (User Manual, documentation, troubleshooting guide, testing)
       
        Automated Scaling
       
         Produce 3D conceptual designs for the portable log scaling scanner
         Assist in assembly and testing of the scanning system 3D and vision scanning components
         Scan sample logs to obtain full log datasets for post processing
       
        Lumber Drying
       
         Assist with laboratory kiln testing of different wood species using different drying conditions including loading/unloading kiln, sample measurements, data processing
       
        General Collaboration
       
         Collaborate with other FPInnovations teams and work groups (eg anticipated projects in our Sustainable Construction ICE)
         Adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
       
       
        QUALIFICATIONS
       
         Be registered in 2nd year or higher of a Bachelor’s degree (University undergraduate) in engineering, or equivalent
       
        SKILLS
       
         Team player, curious and focused on improving the forest industry
         Resilience, adaptability to changing priorities; our research is often weather dependent, which requires us to respond quickly to rapidly changing environments and circumstances
         Positive attitude and open to learning
         Self-motivation and strong organizational skills
         Experience writing Python and Matlab script would be considered an asset
         Functional in English, (written and spoken).
       
       
        FPInnovations is committed to the principle of equal access to employment.

companyInfo/companyDescription: KFC, a subsidiary of Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM.), is a global chicken restaurant brand with a rich, decades-long history of success and innovation. It all started with one cook, Colonel Harland Sanders, who created a finger lickin’ good recipe more than 75 years ago, a list of secret herbs and spices scratched out on the back of the door to his kitchen. Today we still follow his formula for success, with real cooks breading and freshly preparing our delicious chicken by hand in more than 23,000 restaurants in over 140 countries and territories around the world.

description:
This is a 8-16 months' Full-time. Co-op employment opportunity starting May 2024.
 
  This position is open for both Burnaby and Markham offices. To apply, please fill out the application form and include a copy of your transcript in your application.
 
  Please note: Application without a transcript will NOT be considered.
 
  About NETINT Technologies Inc.
 
  NETINT Technologies is a developer of intelligent silicon solutions for data-intensive applications. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver and Toronto. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
 
  NETINT offers competitive salaries, benefits, and endless learning and development opportunities.
 
  Job Scope
 
  As a Co-op Video Codec Engineer, you will be part of a team in video codec design and optimization in NETINT Technologies. You will work closely with architects, algorithm engineers, and other codec engineers in video/image compression and optimization.
 
  Responsibilities
  
 
  
   Participate in video/image codec design and write design documents 
  Use Intel assembly instruction set to speedup software encoders 
  Develop video/image codec algorithm and optimization. 
  Debug software and conduct software unit test 
  Write test cases for design verification and compliance tests 
  Write Python test scripts to automate tests
 
  
  
  Qualifications
  
 
  
   MS or BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering/Science 
  Good knowledge on image/video compression and some knowledge on hardware 
  Experience on assembly language programming 
  Proficient in software programming (C/C++/Python) 
  Hands-on experience in debugging and scripting 
  Good oral and written skills for communication and documentation
 
  
  
  Desirable Skills/Experiences
  
 
  
   Experience in signal processing, multimedia, or video/image compression 
  Experience in video/image quality evaluation
 
  
  
  We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
  Acknowledgment and Agreement
 
  NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.
descriptionHTML:
This is a 8-16 months' Full-time. Co-op employment opportunity starting May 2024.


This position is open for both Burnaby and Markham offices. To apply, please fill out the application form and include a copy of your transcript in your application.


Please note: Application without a transcript will NOT be considered.


About NETINT Technologies Inc.


NETINT Technologies is a developer of intelligent silicon solutions for data-intensive applications.   • Hands-on experience in debugging and scripting
  • Good oral and written skills for communication and documentation

Desirable Skills/Experiences


  • Experience in signal processing, multimedia, or video/image compression
  • Experience in video/image quality evaluation

We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Acknowledgment and Agreement


NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At Francl Architecture, the creative and intelligent evolution of both the design process and the craft of architecture guides our work. The depth of our engagement with clients, users and stakeholders generates sophisticated responses to the unique constellation of social, cultural and environmental concerns of each project. We thrive on the challenge to design and realize a genuinely modern, livable, and sustainable built environment.
We are a diverse and talented team of 50+, working in a collaborative studio environment, located in the Armoury District in Vancouver. Individuals take responsibility for projects from design to completion in a number of sectors, including infrastructure, institutional and recreational as well as mixed-use residential.
description:
Do you want to make a positive impact on the communities we live in? Do you believe that Architecture and good design matters? Are you looking for an office environment that will support and foster your growth?
At Francl Architecture, we thrive on the challenge to design and realize a genuinely modern, livable, and sustainable built environments. Our diverse and talented team of designers work in a collaborative studio environment located in Yaletown in Vancouver, and we offer integrated design services across multiple disciplines in Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Planning and Urban Design and a range of sectors, including institutional, recreational, transportation, civic infrastructure, and mixed-use residential projects.
We are excited to work in teams, expect integrity with a strong focus on quality, are results oriented and above all, we treat each other with respect. We are a diverse group of people, and our office culture supports growth for all our staff. If you would like to find out more details about joining an exceptional team and an enriching learning environment, we would love to hear from you.
POSITION:
Architectural Co-Op Student
We are seeking an architectural student in our design studio during the summer semester from May to September 2024, with flexibility on the beginning and end dates. This is a fixed-term full-time position (37.5 hr / week) in person employment in our vibrant office located in the Yaletown neighborhood of Vancouver. We support our students with mentorship, learning opportunities and exposure to a variety of projects and office activities.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The successful student candidate will be working in a team environment on a variety of projects and stages of design phases. We strive to ensure that students experience all aspects of our practice and we work with students to ensure their time with us is enriching and fulfilling. Students will work directly with a project team and will have access to a mentor that will provide guidance and support. Students may also be engaged with office initiatives with senior staff in the office.
EXPERIENCE
We are seeking students of all experience levels.
SKILLS

 Excellent sense for design and a strong ability to develop design concepts


 Excellence in communication, strong willingness to ask questions and seek guidance


 Motivated team player and self-starter with strong organizational skills


 Proficiency in Revit, Rhino and Adobe Creative Suite is preferred.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 months
Salary: $25.68-$25.75 per year
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Extended health care
 On-site parking

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 AutoCAD: 1 year (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 Vancouver, BC V6B 2W7 (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Vancouver, BC V6B 2W7: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-04-02

description:
About this Position
 
  This is an 8 to 16 months Full-time, Co-op employment opportunity starting May 2024.
 
  This position is open for both Burnaby and Markham offices. To apply, please fill out the application form and include a copy of your transcript in your application.
 
  Please note: Application without a transcript will NOT be considered.
 
  About NETINT Technologies Inc.
 
  NETINT Technologies is a developer of intelligent silicon solutions for data-intensive applications. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver and Toronto. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
 
  NETINT offers competitive salaries, benefits, and endless learning and development opportunities.
 
  Job Scope
 
  As a Co-op Firmware Engineer, you will be part of a team developing high performance embedded software running on SoCs designed by NETINT Technologies. You will work closely with architects, ASIC design engineers, and other firmware engineers in implementing and verifying the firmware design.
 
  Responsibilities
  
 
  
   Participate in firmware design and write design documents 
  Develop firmware that runs on a simulated environment, FPGA and SoC. 
  Debug firmware 
  Conduct firmware unit test 
  Write test cases for design verification and compliance tests 
  Write Python test scripts to automate tests
 
  
  
  Qualifications
  
 
  
   MS or BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering/Science 
  Proficient in structured firmware/software programming (C/C++/Python) 
  Hands-on experience in verification, debugging and scripting 
  Good oral and written skills for communication and documentation
 
  
  
  Desirable Skills/Experiences
  
 
  
   Experience of firmware debugging tools such as JTAG, Emulator, scopes and logical analyzer 
  Experience in NAND flash application development or testing 
  Experience with Agile software development methods
 
  
  
  We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
  Acknowledgment and Agreement
 
  NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

About this Position


This is an 8 to 16 months Full-time, Co-op employment opportunity starting May 2024.


This position is open for both Burnaby and Markham offices. To apply, please fill out the application form and include a copy of your transcript in your application.


Please note: Application without a transcript will NOT be considered.


About NETINT Technologies Inc.


NETINT Technologies is a developer of intelligent silicon solutions for data-intensive applications. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver and Toronto. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.


NETINT offers competitive salaries, benefits, and endless learning and development opportunities.


Job Scope


As a Co-op Firmware Engineer, you will be part of a team developing high performance embedded software running on SoCs designed by NETINT Technologies. You will work closely with architects, ASIC design engineers, and other firmware engineers in implementing and verifying the firmware design.


Responsibilities


  • Participate in firmware design and write design documents
  • Develop firmware that runs on a simulated environment, FPGA and SoC.
  • Debug firmware
  • Conduct firmware unit test
  • Write test cases for design verification and compliance tests
  • Write Python test scripts to automate tests

Qualifications


  • MS or BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering/Science
  • Proficient in structured firmware/software programming (C/C++/Python)
  • Hands-on experience in verification, debugging and scripting
  • Good oral and written skills for communication and documentation

Desirable Skills/Experiences


  • Experience of firmware debugging tools such as JTAG, Emulator, scopes and logical analyzer
  • Experience in NAND flash application development or testing
  • Experience with Agile software development methods

We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:
Indigenous Internship / Auxiliary Appointment –  Summer 2024 
   Named one of BC’s Top Employers for five years running, the BCUC is an independent regulatory  agency of the Government of British Columbia. We ensure that residents and businesses receive  safe, reliable energy and basic auto insurance at fair rates. The BCUC also regulates common carrier  pipeline operations, and we promote market competitiveness by collecting and publishing  information about gasoline and diesel fuel activities in BC. We facilitate fair, transparent, and  inclusive regulatory processes that balance ratepayer interests with the needs of regulated entities  to earn a fair return on their capital investments. 
   About the role: this position is intended to be an engaging and immersive experience that provides  Vision: the successful candidate(s) with opportunities to learn about public utility regulation and to 
   contribute innovative ideas based on their unique perspective as an Indigenous person.  To be a trusted  and respected Working with the BCUC Lead for Indigenous Relations, the successful candidate(s) will: 
   regulator that identify projects/activities that support their interests and skillset(s) and collaboratively  contributes to develop a corresponding workplan for the term of their employment;  the well-being shadow senior BCUC staff and Commissioners to learn from their experience; and  and long-term  interests of all attend regulatory meetings and support proceedings as a member of staff.  British  Columbians. About you: this position is open to students and recent graduates of relevant post-secondary 
   undergraduate and graduate degree programs (e.g., Indigenous studies, law, accounting, energy  management, economics, public policy), as well as professionals with an equivalent combination of 
   experience who currently work with an Indigenous group/organization within BC. 
   The successful candidate(s) will: 
    have lived experience as part of an Indigenous community (or communities); 
   
    have experience with, knowledge of, and/or interest in Indigenous communities, 
   Values: governments, and organizations in BC, as well as energy system(s) and regulation, including 
    Accessibility Indigenous-led energy projects, best practices and emerging trends; 
   Integrity enjoy collaborating and engaging with individuals from a diversity of backgrounds; 
   
    bring strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills; and 
   Responsiveness 
   
    be a resident of BC. 
   Innovation 
   Expected pay range: $25 - 35/hour for students and recent graduates; $30 - 50/hour for established  Excellence professionals. Exact offering within these ranges will be commensurate with a candidate’s education 
   and experience level. 
   Duration: temporary full-time from May - August 2024, or some other mutually agreed upon term.  Exact start and end dates to be confirmed with the successful candidate(s). The BCUC is also open to  discussing flexible working arrangements to ensure accessibility. 
   How to apply: please submit a résumé and cover letter explaining why you are interested in the  opportunity to careers@bcuc.com. 
   Applications will be held in the strictest of confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest,  however, only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
With a team of 22,000 of the world’s best grocers at more than 180 stores from B.C. to Manitoba, Save-On-Foods is one of BC’s Top Employers, B.C.’s Most Loved Brand, and a great place to grow your career. Our legacy of outstanding value and customer service dates back more than 100 years and continues in every community we serve, every day.

We value service, people, innovation, fun and integrity, and we strive to provide the best customer experience in every market where we do business. At Save-On-Foods we provide opportunities for continuous development, competitive total compensation and a fun working environment. We demonstrate corporate responsibility by living our core values supporting local and celebrating our world class team.
description:
As a valued member of an innovative Western Canadian company, our pharmacy teams are passionate about helping our customers and communities embrace healthier lifestyles by delivering quality, patient-centred care. Become an integral part of your community, where your commitment to healthy living makes a difference every day.
 
 
 
   We are hiring for Pharmacy Interns in their 2nd, 3rd, or 4th year at our King Edward location in Vancouver, BC.
 
 
 
   You must currently be enrolled in a Faculty of Pharmacy at an accredited University.
 
 
 
   You will be responsible for:
 
 
   Providing pharmacy services while under the supervision of a full pharmacist.
 
 
 
   Here are some of the perks we have to offer:
 
 
   Get paid every Friday!
   Exclusive team member offers and discounts.
   Opportunities for career advancement into management or clinical positions.
 
 
 
   Compensation Details:
  $18.00 - $24.00
 
   The compensation offered for this position will take into consideration location, education, skills, experience, and other factors.
   
   Join our Team!
   Come and be a part of an energetic and inclusive team where we work together to have fun and achieve our goals. If you are a positive, customer-focused individual, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and add your smile to the mix!

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Atira Property Management Inc. is a mid-sized licensed property management company known for its inclusionary hiring practices and wholly owned by Atira Women’s Resource Society, an award-winning not-for-profit organization. We offer a challenging and rewarding work environment where a job is more than just a paycheck. We offer our staff the opportunity to work alongside a remarkable group of professionals and activists working to make the world a more just place, one tenant, one home, one job at a time.

Atira Property Management offers personalized, client-focused management solutions for strata corporations, building owners, housing cooperatives, not-for-profit societies, and developers in Greater Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

As a socially responsible firm, we offer quality property management services and an opportunity for clients to give back to the community.

Our Values:

Excellence
We have an unwavering commitment to excellence in customer service and progressive property management. This commitment means we carefully monitor the quality, safety, and environmental impact of everything we do.

Social Responsibility
All of Atira Property Management’s profits are donated to the Atira Women’s Resource Society and used to fund transition housing and support services for women and children who are recovering from the effects of violence and abuse within their families.

Innovation
Our work is client-focused, and our staff are encouraged to pursue innovation, creativity, leadership, transparency, and accountability in all aspects of their work. Our goal is to offer excellent service to the community while using innovation to reduce reliance on government funding.
description:
About Us: 
  Atira Property Management Inc. offers quality property management services for strata corporations, developers, rental properties, non-profit housing, and housing cooperatives in Greater Vancouver. As one of the first mission-driven companies of its kind in Canada, Atira Property Management is a social enterprise that grew out of Atira Women's Resource Society. All profits from Atira Property Management are used to help fund the Society’s housing and support programs for women and children affected by violence, as well as to build new, nonmarket housing. 
  The Opportunity: 
  Atira Property Management Inc. currently has a vacancy for an on-site housing co-operative manager. The primary accountabilities of this position consist of the delivery of full co-op management services to a defined portfolio of contracted clients, seeking out and securing new clients, and supervisor the staff assigned to you. Your services must be delivered in a manner consistent with the goals and objectives of APMI which you are expected to be familiar with. The duties which you are expected to perform will vary from time to time. This position requires you to be creative problem solver, have listening skills, patience, flexibility, and a sense of humour. You must be able to demonstrate you respect the people you work with and demonstrate an eagerness for collaboration and transparency. You are also required to set boundaries, supporting people to solve their own problems and issues, as much as possible. 
  About You: 
  You are a detail-oriented person who is able to prioritize and manage your time well, and are committed to attending work regularly and on time. Your enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn/grow are your most important attributes for the position. You may have a three or four of experience in a customer service or other office environment, and perhaps even some formal training in administration work. You question actions inconsistent with our values and you treat everyone with fairness and respect independent of their status or disagreement with you. You expect great things from yourself and your co-workers. You inspire others with your passion for women’s anti-violence work and your eagerness for excellence. You contribute to an environment where tenants can flourish and grow and you seek what is best for the tenants, rather than what is best for you or your team. You challenge the status quo to improve quality and sustainability and you take smart risks and make tough decision without agonizing. 
  Additional Requisites: 
 
  A valid B.C. Class 5 driver’s license and First Aid certificate is 
  At least 3 (three) years of administrative and/or property management 
  Proficient use of office equipment & software – including but not limited to Windows, Microsoft Office, Outlook, 
  Experience with YARDI is an 
  All positions are subject to a criminal record review. 
 
 Application Process: 
  Applications should be emailed to jobs@atira.ca, please mention the position in the subject. Please provide a current resume describing how you meet or exceed the above-noted qualifications. Resumes with a Cover Letter unique to Atira will be preferred. Candidates who lack the experience and qualifications set out in the posting may not be considered, although an exceptional cover letter and transferable skills may overcome lack of experience for some positions. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted. Please go to www.atira.bc.ca/careers for a current list of postings.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Delta is home to a population of approximately 100,000 people. We pride ourselves on our past and our sustainable future. Delta has a hospital, an airport, a museum and archives, libraries, sports and recreational facilities, and many bike and walking trails in a varied network of parks including waterfront parks on the Fraser River, Boundary Bay and Strait of Georgia.



Delta encompasses 180 square kilometres bordered by the Fraser River on the north, the United States border and Boundary Bay on the south, the City of Surrey on the east and the Strait of Georgia on the west.
description:
One of the sunniest regions in BC's Lower Mainland, Delta embraces three unique communities - Ladner, North Delta and Tsawwassen. The City of Delta is looking for dedicated individuals to join our team and share in our commitment to lead the way in public service excellence. 
 City of Delta  Survey Assistant – Summer Co-op
  
  The City of Delta is looking for an engineering technology student to assist with summer vacation relief in our Engineering  Department’s Design and Construction Division. The successful student will work in the Survey Section of the Department and will gain relevant field and office experience specifically geared towards the Geomatics technology field. It is expected that this position will conclude approximately September 2024, however it may be shortened or extended as required.  The intention of this temporary summer position is to provide vacation relief for the survey division in Engineering and provide first or second year Geomatics students an opportunity to be exposed to municipal surveys for future employment considerations. The position will enable the survey teams to continue supporting the capital construction program, ongoing construction layout, and survey pick-up for multiple departments.  This is technical and manual work in assisting a Survey Technician in all aspects of conducting varied survey assignments. An incumbent assists a Survey Technician in moderately complex tasks in survey work; operates all survey instruments used in the Department; and performs non-complex survey assignments independently. Ability to operate a transit and level instruments and participate in the operation and set up of the Total Station and Global Positioning System (GPS) is required.  A Survey Assistant exercises some independence of judgment and action within established guidelines and procedures, referring more difficult matters to a superior who reviews work performance in terms of effective assistance rendered in all aspects of surveying activities.  Required Licences: 
 
  A valid Class 5 BC Driver’s License is required.
 
  The City of Delta provides a competitive salary of $25.93 per hour +12% in lieu of benefits. Interested applicants are requested to apply online at www.delta.ca/employment to competition number 24-84 EX by March 22, 2024.  The City of Delta's Covid-19 Vaccination policy has been suspended, however, we reserve the right to reinstate it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our community, and our Communicable Disease Plan and related protocols remain in place.  We thank all applicants for their interest; only those under consideration will be contacted. Copies of relevant professional certificates, degrees, or tickets must be submitted with your application. Preferred candidates will be required to submit a Police Information Check.
 
 Education : Other trades certificate or diploma 
 Experience : Experience an asset

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Established in 1910, McElhanney is an employee-owned company that provides surveying, engineering, GIS & remote sensing, community planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. We have 30+ locations across Western Canada, and specialty satellite offices in Newfoundland and Labrador and Florida (USA), to service cities, communities & parks, energy & resources, and transportation sectors. We operate locally in the communities where we live and work and share staff resources from across our company.



At McElhanney, we work closely with our clients and partners and take on their challenges like they’re our own. Our clients choose us because of our commitment to safety and quality service, because our relationships are rooted in trust, and because our capable teams have the grit and skill to tackle challenging problems.



We value hiring and keeping great people, attaining operational excellence, and delivering outstanding work to our valued clients. It’s what drives us forward every day.
description:
About McElhanney 
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,400 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals. 

 The Opportunity:
 Join our team as an HR Summer Student and immerse yourself in the dynamic world of Talent Management at McElhanney for a summer placement. This temporary position from May to August, will give you exposure to talent management as a specialty in the field of HR, experience in a professional services environment, and the opportunity to make an impact on our employee experience as we transition to skills-based hiring & employee development. 

 In this position, you will support McElhanney’s Talent Management team in employee engagement action planning, recruitment, and learning & career development resourcing. This position offers in-office options in three locations: Edmonton, Victoria, and Vancouver, with the additional flexibility for a hybrid work arrangement. 

 What You’ll Be Doing:
 
 
 Assist in curating and cataloguing skills-based employee development resources. 
 Support in the data analysis and execution of employee engagement action planning. 
 Collaborate with the recruitment team in developing and maintaining a new interview resource library and talent assessments. 
 Assist with people data analytics projects. 
 Support ad hoc HR projects and initiatives as needed. 
 Skills And Attributes For Success:
 
 
 Communication: Effectively communicate with a diverse group of colleagues to gather requirements and provide updates on project progress. 
 Manage relationships: Collaborate with internal teams to build trust and understand their needs. 
 Manage resources: Develop and implement strategies to optimize the allocation of your time and resources. 
 Business knowledge: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop internal resources that support the needs of the business. 
 Identify solutions: Identify areas for improvement through observation and feedback. 
 What You’ll Bring:
 
 
 Currently enrolled in a Master’s degree program in Human Resources. 
 Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality. 
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. 
 Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Work, Excel, PowerPoint). 
 Hourly Range: $21.00 - $34.52. McElhanney offers fair compensation that is commensurate with the individual’s education, experience, skills, and professional qualifications. The posted base salary range is representative of the required level of qualifications and experience for the position as noted in the job posting. The salary offered will be based on the experience and qualifications of the successful candidate. 

 What’s In It For You? 
You will embark on a rewarding journey with McElhanney, where your contributions will shape the future of our Talent Management initiatives. We are also proud to be listed as one of the Best Places to Work in Canada, one of the Top Employers in BC and we are recognized as Gold Standard for Best Managed Companies. 
Apply now to elevate your HR skills in a dynamic and collaborative environment. 
#LI-SA1 

 Our Commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion 

 At McElhanney, our unwavering commitment lies in cultivating a culture that aligns with our core values and fosters diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate the collective achievements of a team rich in expertise, experiences, and perspectives, and welcome applications from individuals of diverse ethnicities, religions, backgrounds, genders, sexual orientations, gender identities, aboriginal statuses, various age groups, and those with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process. If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements outlined. We’re interested in getting to know you and explore the unique contributions you can bring to McElhanney! 

 If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to learn more. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. 

 To learn more about our recognition as Canada's Top 100 Employers (2024), visit Top Employer: McElhanney Ltd. (canadastop100.com). 

 Visit us on Glassdoor to learn more about our employee experience. 

 Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people. 

 McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning. The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.
