companyInfo/companyDescription:
At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces, support injured workers, and sustain a no-fault insurance system. We are honoured to serve 2.3 million workers and 255,000 employers across B.C.

To discover opportunities for a career that makes a difference, visit worksafebc.com/careers
description:
Job requisition number
        
       038508 
      
      
       
        Job location
        
       Richmond 
      
      
       
        Full-time / part-time
        
       Full-time 
      
      
       
        Salary
        
       $22.38/hourly 
      
      
       
        Posting period 
       
       From 02/21/2024 to 03/06/2024 
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    Overview 
    
     Welcome to our dynamic and dedicated Visiting Specialists Clinic (VSC) team in the Health Care Programs department, where we take pride in our approach to ensuring top-notch care delivery and clinical outcomes for WorkSafeBC’s injured workers. Our team plays a pivotal role in operating an expedited onsite multi-specialty medical clinic. Join us as we continue to make a positive impact on the intersection of healthcare and technology. 
     We’re looking for a highly motivated Co-op Student, to join our Visiting Specialists Clinic in the Health Care Programs department. 
     This is a four-month full-time positions starting in May 2024. 
     How you’ll make a difference: You’ll help us strive towards our vision of supporting injured workers’ recovery and return to work. 
     Where you’ll work 
     In this role, you will be working from our Richmond, BC head office every day. Some opportunity for a hybrid work environment exists, but based on operational needs, as directed by your manager. 
    
    What you'll do 
    
     
      You will be working on the planning and implementation of a new health records system for the medical clinic at WSBC for injured workers.
      
     You will be assisting with transition from manual processes to automated systems and working with the vendor and with different teams ad stakeholders across WSBC on the implementation of the new system. 
     
      Map current and future state workflows for how to transition to new system 
      Preparing digital and paper documents for configuration and transition to electronic system 
      Preparing training and communication materials for new system 
      Helping with hands on training (scheduling, administrative duties as assigned, etc) 
      Performing duties as assigned. 
     
    
    Is this a good fit for you? 
    
     Is this a good fit for you? 
     We’re looking for a person tahat can bring to the role: 
     
      Analytical skills 
      Business analysis 
      Project manager mindset/attitude 
      Passion for technology 
      Communication skills (written/verbal) 
      Team player 
      
     Your background and experience 
     
      3rd or 4th year student, enrolled in business administration, health care, communication program or similarly related program 
      Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel 
      Working knowledge of SharePoint is an asset 
      
     Learn more: Hear from past co-op students on what it’s like to work here. 
     Important to know 
     Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must: 
     
      Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada 
      Confirm you’re a registered student at a post-secondary institution and is participating in a work integrated learning program 
      Consent to a criminal record check and successfully meet the criminal record check clearance 
      
     WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect. 
     Who we are 
     At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province. 
     What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC? 
     It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for. 
     Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. 
     Our Benefits 
     As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work - and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes: 
     
      4% in lieu of benefits 
      4% in lieu of vacation 
      
     Salary: $22.38/hourly 
     Learn more: Discover who we are. 
     Want to apply? 
     
      A cover letter, resume and transcript are required. Your cover letter should state your availability (four or eight months). 
      Submit all documents in one file (either Word or PDF files). 
      Please also provide a written sample of documents you have self-authored. Examples of documents to submit include a paper or report from a school project. 
     
     
      We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

Job requisition number

    038508

    Job location

    Richmond

    Full-time / part-time

    Full-time

    Salary

    $22.38/hourly

    Posting period

    From 02/21/2024 to 03/06/2024

Overview

Welcome to our dynamic and dedicated Visiting Specialists Clinic (VSC) team in the Health Care Programs department, where we take pride in our approach to ensuring top-notch care delivery and clinical outcomes for WorkSafeBC’s injured workers. Our team plays a pivotal role in operating an expedited onsite multi-specialty medical clinic. Join us as we continue to make a positive impact on the intersection of healthcare and technology.

We’re looking for a highly motivated Co-op Student, to join our Visiting Specialists Clinic in the Health Care Programs department.

This is a four-month full-time positions starting in May 2024.

How you’ll make a difference: You’ll help us strive towards our vision of supporting injured workers’ recovery and return to work.

Where you’ll work

In this role, you will be working from our Richmond, BC head office every day. Some opportunity for a hybrid work environment exists, but based on operational needs, as directed by your manager.

What you'll do

You will be working on the planning and implementation of a new health records system for the medical clinic at WSBC for injured workers.

You will be assisting with transition from manual processes to automated systems and working with the vendor and with different teams ad stakeholders across WSBC on the implementation of the new system.

  • Map current and future state workflows for how to transition to new system
  • Preparing digital and paper documents for configuration and transition to electronic system
  • Preparing training and communication materials for new system
  • Helping with hands on training (scheduling, administrative duties as assigned, etc)
  • Performing duties as assigned.

Is this a good fit for you?

Is this a good fit for you?

We’re looking for a person tahat can bring to the role:

  • Analytical skills
  • Business analysis
  • Project manager mindset/attitude
  • Passion for technology
  • Communication skills (written/verbal)
  • Team player

Your background and experience

  • 3rd or 4th year student, enrolled in business administration, health care, communication program or similarly related program
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel
  • Working knowledge of SharePoint is an asset

Learn more: Hear from past co-op students on what it’s like to work here.

Important to know

Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must:

  • Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Confirm you’re a registered student at a post-secondary institution and is participating in a work integrated learning program
  • Consent to a criminal record check and successfully meet the criminal record check clearance

WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.

Who we are

At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province.

What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for.

Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.

Our Benefits

As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work - and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes:

  • 4% in lieu of benefits
  • 4% in lieu of vacation

Salary: $22.38/hourly

Learn more: Discover who we are.

Want to apply?

  • A cover letter, resume and transcript are required. Your cover letter should state your availability (four or eight months).
  • Submit all documents in one file (either Word or PDF files).
  • Please also provide a written sample of documents you have self-authored. Examples of documents to submit include a paper or report from a school project.
  • We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
SAP is one of the world’s leading producers of software for business process management. Today, SAP has over 250 million cloud users and more than 100 solutions covering all industries and business functions.

Every day, we help companies and organizations of all sizes and industries to run their businesses profitably, to adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
description:
We help the world run better
 
  Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
  About the SAP Internship Experience Program
 
  The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.
 
  Three reasons to intern at SAP
 
   Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
   Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
   Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
 
 
  What you’ll do
 
  Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Data Scientist
 
  Location: Vancouver, BC (On-site)
 
  Expected Start Date: 6 May 2024
 
  Contract Duration: 8 months
 
  Work Hours: 40 hours per week
 
  The SAP Vancouver Labs is offering a paid research and innovation internship starting May 2024 for an 8 months period (with an option to extend by 4 months). We are looking for innovative graduate and undergraduate students who are excited about pushing the state of the art in technology legal compliance tools, pattern detection & classification and data analytics by drawing on research in LLMs, machine learning, natural language processing, data mining, information visualization and other related areas.
 
  We offer interns the opportunity to apply their theoretical knowledge to explore solutions to real-life technical problems and develop tools used in compliance operations. Interns will work in the dynamic fast-paced Global Technology Legal Compliance team that plays a key role in ensuring SAP products and solutions comply with technical legal requirements such as software licensing laws and trade regulations. Interns will have access to support from world-class data scientists, domain experts, software development and user experience teams. We explore opportunities for technology transfer and publish in leading conferences. We strive to create an environment that is both productive and fun.
  We are located in beautiful Vancouver in the heart of Yaletown, steps away from a wide variety of restaurants, public transit, and downtown.
  
 
 
   Apply research to real-world technical problems
   Develop and extend tools used in Technology Legal Compliance
   Follow up on latest trends and share the knowledge among the team
   Participate in project meetings to support project goals, requirements, processes, deliverables, and timelines
 
 
  What you bring
 
  We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
 
  Requirements:
 
   Undergraduate, Master’s or PhD student in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, Data Science, or Mathematics/Statistics
   Strong research, analytical, and software prototyping skills
   Self-motivated, with interest in natural language processing and its application to real world problems
   Proficient knowledge of Python
   Working knowledge of prompt engineering
   Commitment to 8-month full-time internship
 
 
  Desired:
 
   Familiarity with using computer programming languages such as Java and C++
   Familiarity with deep learning and neural network frameworks (e.g., Pytorch, TensorFlow)
   Familiarity with using data analysis tools (e.g., SciPy, Pandas), ML technologies (e.g., scikit-learn, MLflow) and latest developments in Generative AI (e.g., LLMs)
   Experience developing user interfaces with HTML5, CSS and Javascript
 
  Meet your team
 
  Global Technology Legal Compliance is a team in SAP that drives best in class standards for IP compliance. We enable and accelerate the product innovation life cycle by advising SAP development teams across the globe.
 
  We build breakthroughs together
 
  SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
 
  We win with inclusion
 
  SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world. SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
  For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
 
  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
 
  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
  SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 24-40 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to appliable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by clicking this link: SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com
  Requisition ID: 387538 | Work Area: Information Technology | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Intern | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid

We win with inclusion


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.


EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 24-40 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to appliable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by clicking this link: SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com

description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  
 Job Description Summary: 
 
 The Test R&D Engineer, Co-op will work with the Opto-mechanical Test R&D team to ensure we develop high quality products within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio. Test R&D engineers design test methods and supporting fixtures, evaluate product designs through testing, and ensure our products meet Stryker’s high standards for product quality while meeting the needs of our customers and our business. The role requires someone who has great communication, problem-solving, and technical skills.
 
  Essential Functions:
 
   Participate as part of the Test R&D team throughout development from design feasibility up to product launch.
   Work closely with cross-functional teams including Project Managers, Design, Quality, Manufacturing, etc.
   Assist in the design and development of test methods and fixtures to support new product development within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio.
   Perform testing throughout the project and appropriately documenting procedures and results
   Evaluate design options and bench testing to help inform decisions in product development.
   Support prototyping efforts for product development and test fixturing. 
 
 
 Qualifications:
 
   Education:
   
     Third year undergrad or higher in mechanical, optical, mechatronics, or other related engineering fields.
   
   Knowledge:
   
     Experience with CAD software (preferably SolidWorks)
     Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (i.e., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
     Experience with data compilation and analysis
     Ability to create technical documentation when required.
   
   General Skills:
   
     Excellent written and oral communication
     Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
     Ability to manage priorities and workflow to meet commitments.
     Versatility and flexibility to work in a job environment that may have consistently changing priorities.
     Proven ability to handle projects and meet deadlines.
     Strong interpersonal skills
     Good judgement with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
     Self-managed and motivated
   
 
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
  The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces, support injured workers, and sustain a no-fault insurance system. We are honoured to serve 2.3 million workers and 255,000 employers across B.C.

To discover opportunities for a career that makes a difference, visit worksafebc.com/careers
description:
Job requisition number
        
       038513 
      
      
       
        Job location
        
       Richmond 
      
      
       
        Full-time / part-time
        
       Full-time 
      
      
       
        Salary
        
       24.55/hour 
      
      
       
        Posting period 
       
       From 02/21/2024 to 03/06/2024 
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    Overview 
    
     The Business, Security and End-User Services (BSES) department of WorkSafeBC is looking for one highly motivated, dynamic, innovative Co-op student, Cybersecurity and Identity Analyst to join our team to help us strive towards our vision. 
     The BSES department provides an exceptional technology experience for our organization by meeting end-user expectations for technology education and support, offering best-in-class Cybersecurity, and ensuring transparent and accountable decision-making through governance practices and policies. This is a eight-month temporary opportunity starting in May 2024. 
     
      How you’ll make a difference: You’ll support innovations that benefit workers and employers across B.C.
     
      
      
     Where you’ll work 
     At WorkSafeBC, we offer a hybrid work model that combines the convenience of working remotely with the dynamism of working in one of our offices, based on the operational needs of the position. 
     In this role, you’ll work primarily from your B.C. home and be on-site roughly once per month in our Richmond office. 
    
    What you'll do 
    
     
      Implement and monitor information security measures for the safeguarding of computer facilities and corporate data 
      Provide technical support for security tools and procedures 
      Assist in the analysis of security risks and exposures 
      Assist in the creation of policies and procedures 
      Assist in the evaluation of new tools, technologies and procedures related to information security 
      Assist in the analysis of identity provisioning and role engineering 
     
    
    Is this a good fit for you? 
    
     We're looking for someone who can: 
     
      Implement, direct and enforce logical security 
      Monitor the existing information systems environment for possible security exposures; ensuring identified exposures are kept as confidential as possible; act upon problem, evaluating risk and identifying potential impact and determining an appropriate course of action 
      Provide consultation to IT staff and guardians of information assets to assist them in applying appropriate security measures 
      Participate in research and evaluations of logical and physical security products and procedures 
      Participate in awareness programs to heighten security consciousness among users; makes information presentations regarding security issues as required 
      Contribute to a positive work environment by collaborating and working effectively as a member of the team 
      Think critically while also having fun working through complex problems 
      
     Learn more: Hear from past co-op students on what it’s like to work here. 
     Your background and experience 
     
      Currently a 3rd or 4th year student enrolled in a cybersecurity, computer science or related program 
      Previous co-op or relevant work experience in an office environment is preferred 
      Microsoft 365 applications and Microsoft Azure experience is an asset 
     
     Important to know 
     Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must: 
     
      Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada 
      Confirm you’re a registered student at a post-secondary institution and is participating in a work integrated learning program 
      
     WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect. 
     Who are we? 
     At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province. 
     What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC? 
     It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for. 
     
      Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.
     
      
     
     Our Benefits 
     As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work - and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes: 
     
      4% in lieu of benefits 
      4% in lieu of vacation 
      
     Learn more: Discover who we are. 
     Salary: $24.55/hourly 
     Learn more: Discover who we are. 
     Want to apply? 
     
      A cover letter, resume and transcript are required. Your cover letter should state your availability (four or eight months). 
      Submit all documents in one file (either Word or PDF files). 
     
     
      We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

Overview

The Business, Security and End-User Services (BSES) department of WorkSafeBC is looking for one highly motivated, dynamic, innovative Co-op student, Cybersecurity and Identity Analyst to join our team to help us strive towards our vision.

The BSES department provides an exceptional technology experience for our organization by meeting end-user expectations for technology education and support, offering best-in-class Cybersecurity, and ensuring transparent and accountable decision-making through governance practices and policies. This is a eight-month temporary opportunity starting in May 2024.

How you’ll make a difference: You’ll support innovations that benefit workers and employers across B.C.

Where you’ll work

At WorkSafeBC, we offer a hybrid work model that combines the convenience of working remotely with the dynamism of working in one of our offices, based on the operational needs of the position.

In this role, you’ll work primarily from your B.C. home and be on-site roughly once per month in our Richmond office.

What you'll do

  • Implement and monitor information security measures for the safeguarding of computer facilities and corporate data
  • Provide technical support for security tools and procedures
  • Assist in the analysis of security risks and exposures
  • Assist in the creation of policies and procedures
  • Assist in the evaluation of new tools, technologies and procedures related to information security
  • Assist in the analysis of identity provisioning and role engineering

Is this a good fit for you?

We're looking for someone who can:

  • Implement, direct and enforce logical security
  • Monitor the existing information systems environment for possible security exposures; ensuring identified exposures are kept as confidential as possible; act upon problem, evaluating risk and identifying potential impact and determining an appropriate course of action
  • Provide consultation to IT staff and guardians of information assets to assist them in applying appropriate security measures
  • Participate in research and evaluations of logical and physical security products and procedures
  • Participate in awareness programs to heighten security consciousness among users; makes information presentations regarding security issues as required

Learn more: Hear from past co-op students on what it’s like to work here.

Your background and experience

  • Currently a 3rd or 4th year student enrolled in a cybersecurity, computer science or related program
  • Previous co-op or relevant work experience in an office environment is preferred
  • Microsoft 365 applications and Microsoft Azure experience is an asset

Important to know

  • Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada

WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.

Who are we?

At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province.

What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for.

Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.

Our Benefits

As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work - and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes:

  • 4% in lieu of benefits
  • 4% in lieu of vacation

Learn more: Discover who we are.

Salary: $24.55/hourly

Learn more: Discover who we are.

Want to apply?

  • A cover letter, resume and transcript are required. Your cover letter should state your availability (four or eight months).
  • Submit all documents in one file (either Word or PDF files).
  • We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  
 Basic Function
 
   The primary responsibility will be assisting with the mechanical design of various products of the Stryker Endoscopy portfolio with particular focus on hand-held medical imaging products.
   
     Complete portfolio of products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/endoscopy.html
   
   It will be a mix of design/testing (40%), and technical writing/meetings/quality management system development (60%).
   This 8-month co-op term is preferably aimed at applicants in a master’s program or in their 4th/3rd year of a Biomedical, Mechanical, Mechatronics (or similar) program. It would be advantageous to have completed a 2 t to 3 previous co-op terms.
   This position will require mostly in-office time at our Burnaby site.
   This position provides an opportunity to learn about the design and development and implementation of medical devices within a quality management system. Provides opportunity to design in CAD and exposure to fabrication techniques (3D printing, machining, etc). Provides opportunity to learn ASTM standards for drawings as well as other critical engineering skill sets.
 
 
  Responsibilities
  SPECIFIC:
 
   Releasing Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s) of Device Master Record (DMR) documents into our Agile Product Lifecycle Management software.
   Evaluation of mechanical design options and bench testing to determine acceptability criteria and optimal solution given a constrained timeline.
   Progress updates to be provided in meetings as required.
   Creation of test protocols, conducting tests and generating test reports.
   Vendor identification and liaison in support of prototyping and new product development
   Design and build test fixtures and jigs in support of verification and product testing, as needed.
   Additional responsibilities may include assisting in assembly of prototype devices, development of opto-mechanical jigs & fixture, supporting the project manager as required.
 
  GENERAL:
  While working with a team of engineers and under the supervision of a senior engineer, the co-op will be
  expected to engage on some of the following types of activities:
 
   Quality Management System DHF/DMR development on new and existing products, including documentation, meetings, and liaising across cross-functional teams.
   Participate in front-end conceptual design and engineering activities on new products.
   Sourcing components and identifying appropriate vendors.
   Product and component testing both in the form of early laboratory prototypes and final, formal product
 
  verification testing.
 
   Design of test setups and testing conditions to investigate options for improving device performance.
   May work with vendor engineers to design systems, and during early design stages to perform evaluations and experiments.
   Participate in design reviews, risk management and associated risk control assessment.
   Understand and follow proper procedures and best practices; work with senior engineers to improve them.
   Actively contribute to and respect team decisions; strive for and abide by consensus; operate within Company
 
  core values.
 
   Contribute to project planning and commit to deliverable goals. Proactively report progress to project
 
  management and R&D management when required.
 
   Take direction as needed from senior engineers and R&D managers; complete most tasks with minimal
 
  guidance; use resources responsibly and effectively.
 
   Proactively seek out senior technical leaders and managers as necessary.
 
 
  Physical requirements
 
   Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 kilograms of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently to lift, carry, etc. generally involves sitting most of the time.
   Must be able to communicate with groups of people.
   Must be able to review printed materials.
   Ability to use common office equipment.
 
  Mental requirements
 
   Self-managed, self-motivated, with excellent hands-on problem-solving skills.
   Must be able to generate and explain design objectives.
   Must be able to complete detailed documentation accurately. Astute attention to detail.
   Must demonstrate creative thinking and paper-based problem-solving ability.
   Must be able to review and troubleshoot designs and provide constructive feedback. Listens to others within the team environment to understand their thinking.
 
  Skills/Experience required
 
   Self-managed and self-motivated.
   Hands-on problem-solving skills
   Fluent with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, etc.).
   Experience in 3D CAD modeling software, preferably SolidWorks.
   Experience with Product Lifecycle Management software, Agile PLM or similar.
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
   Proven ability to write procedures and present complex problems and solutions.
 
  Education/training required
 
   Enrolled in an engineering program – preferably Masters, 4th/3rd year of an Engineering program (ME, EE, Biomedical, Integrated, Biomechanics, or similar)
   Available for an 8-month co-op term
 
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
  The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

core values.

  • Contribute to project planning and commit to deliverable goals. Proactively report progress to project

management and R&D management when required.

  • Take direction as needed from senior engineers and R&D managers; complete most tasks with minimal

guidance; use resources responsibly and effectively.

  • Proactively seek out senior technical leaders and managers as necessary.

Physical requirements

  • Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 kilograms of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently to lift, carry, etc. generally involves sitting most of the time.
  • Must be able to communicate with groups of people.
  • Must be able to review printed materials.
  • Ability to use common office equipment.

Mental requirements

  • Self-managed, self-motivated, with excellent hands-on problem-solving skills.
  • Must be able to generate and explain design objectives.
  • Must be able to complete detailed documentation accurately. Astute attention to detail.
  • Must demonstrate creative thinking and paper-based problem-solving ability.
  • Must be able to review and troubleshoot designs and provide constructive feedback. Listens to others within the team environment to understand their thinking.

Skills/Experience required

  • Self-managed and self-motivated.
  • Hands-on problem-solving skills
  • Fluent with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, etc.).
  • Experience in 3D CAD modeling software, preferably SolidWorks.
  • Experience with Product Lifecycle Management software, Agile PLM or similar.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven ability to write procedures and present complex problems and solutions.

Education/training required

  • Enrolled in an engineering program – preferably Masters, 4th/3rd year of an Engineering program (ME, EE, Biomedical, Integrated, Biomechanics, or similar)
  • Available for an 8-month co-op term


About Stryker

Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.

The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Fairleigh Dickinson University is a private, coeducational and nonsectarian university founded in 1942. Fairleigh Dickinson University is the first American university to own and operate an international campus and currently offers more than 100 individual degree programs to its students.
description:
General Description:
 
 
   The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will identify, establish, and maintain relationships with industry partners, and collaborating with faculty members to facilitate and coordinate practicum placements and other work-integrated learning opportunities that align with student and program goals. By providing overall administrative support in accordance with FDU policies and protocols, the Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will conduct tasks such as guiding employers to facilitate meaningful student work experiences and successful placements, recruiting students for the work-integrated learning program, designing and delivering internship orientation and pre-employment training (in-person and online), advising students to prepare for internship search, monitoring student work terms, visiting practicum sites and addressing any workplace issues that students encounter, and marketing the program to employers.
 
  
   Supervision Received: 
 
 
  The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator reports to the Associate Director of Career Services and receives supervision concerning objectives to be achieved. The incumbent is expected to work independently and collaboratively on daily tasks and special projects, as well as collaborate with other key internal and external constituent groups. 
   
   Principal Duties: Student Advising 
 
 
  1. Provide employment coaching and overall guidance to students towards developing realistic goals and internship search plan based on their program of study.
   
 
 
  2. Design, develop, and facilitate comprehensive job search workshops and training sessions on all aspects of work-integrated learning goals and career development.
   
 
 
  3. Assist students with job application preparation, job search strategies and interview preparation through one-on-one appointments.
   
 
 
  4. Provide relevant and accurate information regarding the internship process and requirements.
   
 
 
  5. Monitor and provide ongoing support during and after completion of the internship program.
 
 
 
    Employer and Faculty Relations
   
 
 
  1. Manage, liaise with, and grow a base of internship employers by researching and developing internship opportunities based on the needs of student interns and their programs of study.
   
 
 
  2. Liaise with corporations, government agencies, and employment service providers for internship placements.
   
 
 
  3. Assist employers with onboarding student interns.
   
 
 
  4. Conduct internship site visits to evaluate student performance in the workplace and help resolve performance issues.
   
 
 
  5. Collaborate with faculty members to identify work-integrated learning opportunities that align with program objectives and student learning outcomes.
   
 
 
  6. Work closely with faculty to integrate work-integrated learning components into the curriculum at the course or program level.
   
 
 
  7. Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
 
 
 
   Direction to Others
 
 
   None
 
  
   Standards: 
 
 
  1. Understand and effectively communicate Campus and Department policies, procedures, and practices.
   
 
 
  2. Use strong communication skills and judgment in all contact with industry partners, faculty, students, and staff members.
   
 
 
  3. Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
   
 
 
  4. Carry out duties without direct or immediate supervision and work on a diversity of projects simultaneously, using independent judgment and discretion.
   
 
 
  5. Independently compose correspondence and other materials, and handle correspondence/reports with a very high level of accuracy.
   
 
 
  6. Well organized, results oriented, and able to set priorities and manage time efficiently.
   
 Required Qualifications: 
 
   Minimum Qualifications: 
 
 
  1. A minimum of an undergraduate degree in Business or in a discipline that emphasizes career development, counseling, experiential learning, adult education, management, communication, or a related discipline.
   
 
 
  2. A minimum of 3+ years of related work experience in work-integrated learning or co-op coordination, recruitment, human resources, or business development.
 
 
   3. Previous experience in providing career advising or counselling services to post-secondary students preferred.
   
 
 
  4. Ability to liaise with industry partners to develop and maintain relationships.
   
 
 
  5. Excellent interpersonal skills, enthusiastic, proactive, and motivated in managing partner relationships.
   
 
 
  6. Ability to be thorough, accurate, and have a high level of attention to detail.
   
 
 
  7. Superior communications skills. Ease at public speaking.
   
 
 
  8. Fluency in a second language and experience with international students/employers an asset.
   
 
 
  9. Canadian residency or work permit required.
   
 
 
  10. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory background check. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the background check and produce a Social Insurance Number.
   
 Preferred Qualifications: Hours Worked 
 
  35
  Posting Date: 02/23/2024 Special Instructions to Applicants: Application Types Accepted: Application for Employment
descriptionHTML:
General Description:
The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will identify, establish, and maintain relationships with industry partners, and collaborating with faculty members to facilitate and coordinate practicum placements and other work-integrated learning opportunities that align with student and program goals. By providing overall administrative support in accordance with FDU policies and protocols, the Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will conduct tasks such as guiding employers to facilitate meaningful student work experiences and successful placements, recruiting students for the work-integrated learning program, designing and delivering internship orientation and pre-employment training (in-person and online), advising students to prepare for internship search, monitoring student work terms, visiting practicum sites and addressing any workplace issues that students encounter, and marketing the program to employers.

Supervision Received:
The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator reports to the Associate Director of Career Services and receives supervision concerning objectives to be achieved. The incumbent is expected to work independently and collaboratively on daily tasks and special projects, as well as collaborate with other key internal and external constituent groups.

Principal Duties: Student Advising
1. Provide employment coaching and overall guidance to students towards developing realistic goals and internship search plan based on their program of study.
2. Design, develop, and facilitate comprehensive job search workshops and training sessions on all aspects of work-integrated learning goals and career development.
3. Assist students with job application preparation, job search strategies and interview preparation through one-on-one appointments.
4. Provide relevant and accurate information regarding the internship process and requirements.
5. Monitor and provide ongoing support during and after completion of the internship program.

Employer and Faculty Relations
1. Manage, liaise with, and grow a base of internship employers by researching and developing internship opportunities based on the needs of student interns and their programs of study.
2. Liaise with corporations, government agencies, and employment service providers for internship placements.
3. Assist employers with onboarding student interns.
4. Conduct internship site visits to evaluate student performance in the workplace and help resolve performance issues.
5. Collaborate with faculty members to identify work-integrated learning opportunities that align with program objectives and student learning outcomes.
6. Work closely with faculty to integrate work-integrated learning components into the curriculum at the course or program level.
7. Perform other work-related duties as assigned.

Direction to Others
None

Standards:
1. Understand and effectively communicate Campus and Department policies, procedures, and practices.
2. Use strong communication skills and judgment in all contact with industry partners, faculty, students, and staff members.
3. Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
4. Carry out duties without direct or immediate supervision and work on a diversity of projects simultaneously, using independent judgment and discretion.
5. Independently compose correspondence and other materials, and handle correspondence/reports with a very high level of accuracy.
6. Well organized, results oriented, and able to set priorities and manage time efficiently.
Required Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications:
1. A minimum of an undergraduate degree in Business or in a discipline that emphasizes career development, counseling, experiential learning, adult education, management, communication, or a related discipline.
2. A minimum of 3+ years of related work experience in work-integrated learning or co-op coordination, recruitment, human resources, or business development.
3. Previous experience in providing career advising or counselling services to post-secondary students preferred.
4. Ability to liaise with industry partners to develop and maintain relationships.
5. Excellent interpersonal skills, enthusiastic, proactive, and motivated in managing partner relationships.
6. Ability to be thorough, accurate, and have a high level of attention to detail.
7. Superior communications skills. Ease at public speaking.
8. Fluency in a second language and experience with international students/employers an asset.
9. Canadian residency or work permit required.
10. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory background check. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the background check and produce a Social Insurance Number.
Preferred Qualifications: Hours Worked
35
Posting Date: 02/23/2024 Special Instructions to Applicants: Application Types Accepted: Application for Employment

description:
Organization Description: 
Continuing the 40-year-old legacy of Architectural expertise of David Eaton Architect we have now metamorphized to ParaMorph Architecture Inc. with the same passion & commitment.
ParaMorph Architecture Inc. merges collaboration, creativity, and practical innovation to serve diverse sectors such as commercial, multi-family, industrial, mixed-use & institutional projects across British Columbia. Specializing in Parametric design, we craft dynamic, responsive structures that integrate seamlessly with their surroundings. Join our cozy studio nestled in the heart of Surrey’s innovation & technology hub to shape the future of architecture together.
Visit www.paramorph.com to learn more about our work.
Job Description: 
We are seeking an experienced Intern Architect with 8-10 years of professional experience in multifamily & commercial development to join our Surrey studio in a permanent full-time position. The ideal candidate will have expertise in the preparation of construction drawings, development permit drawings, & building permit applications.
Requirements: 
Candidates will be involved in all areas of architectural practice from planning through to construction. Our studio’s approach is a collaborative one, allowing our employees to work on a broad spectrum of project types, at various stages with support and mentorship.

 Must be fully registered or be fully registered with AIBC as an Intern Architect
 Ability to manage timelines with continued proficiency is a must
 Strong understanding of Building Bylaw, BC Building Code & other relevant Municipal Zoning Regulations
 Detailed understanding of construction systems – wood frame, steel, and concrete.
 Detailed understanding of building envelope design.
 Proficiency in AutoCAD & Revit. Knowledge of Sketchup, Photoshop, Lumion, & Bluebeam is an asset.
 Expertise in creating thorough, high-quality sets of drawings, with design understanding & excellent graphic skills to prepare presentation materials & construction documents
 Liaison with interdisciplinary experts & external professionals like clients, contractors, consultants etc., effectively
 Ability to work independently & as a part of team
 Proof of eligibility to work in Canada
 Excellent communication (written & verbal) & interpersonal skills with positive can-do attitude

We offer: 

 Collaborative work environment for steady growth
 Competitive salary as per industry standards
 Monthly learning opportunities
 Strong hands-on leadership & mentorship
 Support for Internship in Architecture
 No cost onsite Gym & Wellness studio
 Great medical & dental benefits
 Close to transit for an easy commute

Contact Info:
Please submit your resume & portfolio by email to hr@paramorph.com with the subject heading: Intern Architect Feb 2024.
Due to the high volume of applications, only selected candidates will be contacted for interviews.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80,000.00-$90,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Company events
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Discounted or free food
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 On-site gym
 Paid time off
 Tuition reimbursement
 Vision care
 Wellness program

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

 Surrey, BC V3T 4J1 (preferred)

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription: DECO Windshield Repair has been operating since 2005 and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name for windshield repair, crack repair, and windshield Glass Treatment application across Canada.
description:
$17.75/hr + Commission + Tips
Average First Year Operator Wage: $24.00/hr
Are you a top performer? Do you love to work independently? Do you have what it takes to become a team member at DECO Windshield Repair?
DECO operates seasonally from March to November and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name across Canada for windshield repair and our repair plans.
We are now hiring full-time/part-time Site Operators across Canada and specifically in Richmond for our 2024 Season!
Summary:
As a Site Operator with DECO you'll be communicating with customers, repairing windshield damage, selling repair plans, and servicing our existing repair plan customers; all while providing the customer an unforgettable experience. The best part? You'll be outside all day independently running your own kiosk while still being part of a team.
With support from an experienced manager in a fun company culture that likes to work hard and play hard, you are in for the best season of your life!
Requirements:
- Must have excellent people and verbal skills and be willing to engage with customers
- Sales experience is preferred
- Must be driven, motivated, and independent
- Be able to stand for long periods of time
- Access to a vehicle is a requirement
Although sales experience is preferred, no previous experience is necessary to work at DECO since we provide extensive training both on-site and off-site. We pay a base wage and a competitive commission structure based on your individual sales, each day.
At DECO Windshield Repair we pay our employee's top of market; however - you have to earn it.
No handouts here. If you're looking for a job where you can work independently and be responsible for you own wage and earnings, we invite you to apply. Top performers only!
Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience and performance. The range listed is just one component of DECO's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, tips, trips (Calgary Stampede + Mexico Trip) and many region-specific benefits and events.Salary Range Transparency$17.75 - 24.00+ per hour

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday
 Weekends as needed

 Bonus pay
 Commission pay
 Retention bonus
 Tips

companyInfo/companyDescription:
À PROPOS DE FPINNOVATIONS 

FPInnovations est un organisme sans but lucratif qui se spécialise dans la création de solutions afin de soutenir la compétitivité du secteur forestier canadien à l’échelle mondiale. L’organisme jouit d’une position idéale pour effectuer de la recherche de pointe, concevoir des technologies avancées et offrir des solutions novatrices à des problèmes complexes, et ce, à chaque élément de la chaîne des valeurs du secteur, des opérations forestières aux produits industriels et de consommation.

 
ABOUT FPINNOVATIONS

FPInnovations is a private not-for-profit organization that specializes in the creation of solutions in support of the Canadian forest sector’s global competitiveness. It is ideally positioned to perform state-of-the-art research, develop advanced technologies, and deliver innovative solutions to complex problems for every area of the sector’s value chain, from forest operations to consumer and industrial products.
description:
Chez FPInnovations, nous ne nous contentons pas d'offrir des emplois, nous offrons des possibilités de carrière qui vous permettront de contribuer de façon significative à l'industrie forestière canadienne. Nous comptons sur l'expertise exceptionnelle de plus de 330 employés pour soutenir nos sociétés membres et l'industrie.
   
    Vous pouvez vous attendre à
   
     Une organisation en pleine transformation qui met l'accent sur l'agilité et l'innovation
     Travailler avec des personnes dévouées et passionnées
     Un soutien dans la réalisation de vos objectifs professionnels
     Une politique de télétravail hybride lorsque cela est possible
     Semaine de travail du lundi au vendredi avec des options d'horaires flexibles (peut nécessiter des déplacements le week-end).
   
   
    RESPONSABILITÉS
    La stagiaire, le stagiaire doit soutenir plusieurs projets au sein du Centre d'excellence en innovation pour la transformation du bois (ICE) à Vancouver, en Colombie-Britannique, notamment les projets et responsabilités suivants :
    Optimisation de l'écorceuse
   
     Organiser/étiqueter/segmenter les images de journaux pour l'optimisation de l'écorceuse.
     Rédiger un script python ou Matlab pour le prétraitement des images.
     Aider à faire l'inventaire de nos capteurs et de l'électronique, des emplacements, des manuels, etc. (y compris les caméras, les lasers, le NIR, les rayons X, etc.)
     Aider à la commercialisation du système de détection Drylog (manuel de l'utilisateur, documentation, guide de dépannage, tests).
   
    Mise à l'échelle automatisée
   
     Produire des dessins conceptuels en 3D pour le scanner portable de mise à l'échelle des billes.
     Participer à l'assemblage et aux essais du système de balayage 3D et des composants de balayage visuel.
     Scanner des échantillons de grumes afin d'obtenir des ensembles de données complets pour le post-traitement.
   
    Séchage du bois
   
     Participer aux essais de séchage en laboratoire de différentes essences de bois dans différentes conditions de séchage, y compris le chargement/déchargement du four, les mesures d'échantillons et le traitement des données.
   
    Collaboration générale
   
     Collaborer avec d'autres équipes et groupes de travail de FPInnovations (p. ex. projets prévus dans le cadre de notre CIE sur la construction durable).
     Respecter et parrainer les règles et procédures en matière de sécurité et d'environnement.
   
   
    QUALIFICATIONS
   
     Être inscrit.e en deuxième année ou plus d'un baccalauréat - premier cycle universitaire, en ingénierie, ou équivalent.
   
   
    COMPÉTENCES
   
     Esprit d'équipe, curiosité et volonté d'améliorer l'industrie forestière
     Résilience, adaptabilité aux priorités changeantes ; nos recherches dépendent souvent des conditions météorologiques, ce qui nous oblige à réagir rapidement à des environnements et des circonstances qui changent rapidement.
     Attitude positive et ouverture à l'apprentissage
     Motivation personnelle et solides compétences organisationnelles
     Une expérience dans l'écriture de scripts Python et Matlab serait un atout.
     Maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et parlé).
   
   
    FPInnovations souscrit au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi.

Optimisation de l'écorceuse

  • Aider à faire l'inventaire de nos capteurs et de l'électronique, des emplacements, des manuels, etc. (y compris les caméras, les lasers, le NIR, les rayons X, etc.)
  • Aider à la commercialisation du système de détection Drylog (manuel de l'utilisateur, documentation, guide de dépannage, tests).

Mise à l'échelle automatisée

COMPÉTENCES

  • Esprit d'équipe, curiosité et volonté d'améliorer l'industrie forestière
  • Résilience, adaptabilité aux priorités changeantes ; nos recherches dépendent souvent des conditions météorologiques, ce qui nous oblige à réagir rapidement à des environnements et des circonstances qui changent rapidement.
  • Attitude positive et ouverture à l'apprentissage
  • Motivation personnelle et solides compétences organisationnelles
  • Une expérience dans l'écriture de scripts Python et Matlab serait un atout.
  • Maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et parlé).


FPInnovations souscrit au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi.
positionName: Stagiaire - Fabrication avancée, produits du bois

companyInfo/companyDescription: Based in Burnaby, BC, Bluvec Technologies Inc. is the pioneering developer of Deep Signal Inspection (DSI) and Rapid Target Inspection (RTI)  technology. We are a leading supplier of software and hardware systems for accurate passive detection and localization of unmanned aerial vehicles. Our team of engineers has spent years developing and testing these solutions before sharing them with the world. We are committed to protecting organisations by providing them with reliable airspace security. We provide a cutting-edge solution that recognises and classifies all types of drones whether they be based on proprietary or standardised air interfaces such as WiFi. Our advanced database contains 98% of the drone models available in the drone market today. Bluvec’s system uses intelligent, AI-enhanced algorithms that can detect the difference between drones and other flying objects such as birds or planes. The data from Bluvec sensors can be hosted on-site or in the cloud, and our solution can also be easily integrated with other hardware, such as radars and photoelectric sensors.
description:
At least 12 or 16 MONTH WORK TERM
Burnaby-based, Bluvec Technologies Inc. is a dynamic tech company that is leading the C-UAS industry with a fresh approach to the market and exceptional solutions. With core designers from Microsoft, Viavi, and Fortinet, we focus on designing best-in-class Counter-drone technology - both hardware and software – to help our clients in the public and private sectors secure their airspace. This is an excellent opportunity to join a high-tech company that provides a fast-paced work environment applying cutting-edge tools to a new market. Who are you?  Ideal candidate is a Software QA Intern with Strong Customer Service and Sales Skills. The ideal candidate will possess a proactive, "service-first" attitude, combined with superior interpersonal and presentation skills to provide strong customer service.
Requirements

 Have a driver's license
 Have or plan to obtain a drone pilot certificate (company support, PR or citizen required)
 Strong communication and demonstration skills
 Experience in project management and QA methodology
 Familiarity with Agile frameworks and regression testing is a plus
 BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
 Familiarity with Agile frameworks and regression testing is a plus
 A proactive, “service-first” attitude combined with superior interpersonal and presentation skills

Responsibilities

 Excellent oral/communication skills to conduct virtual & live demonstrations for customers.
 Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases for hardware, software, release, and functional tests.
 Execute indoor and outdoor test cases (manual or automated) and analyze results.


 Generate test analysis reports, and provide useful sights and suggestions for product improvements and enhancements.
 Create logs to document testing phases and defects
 Report bugs and errors to development teams
 Help troubleshoot issues
 Conduct post-release/ post-implementation testing
 Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle

Additional:

 Flexible schedule
 Comprehensive Medical Benefits, after becoming full time employee
 Opportunity for advancement
 Inclusive, fun, and vibrant work environment
 Return offer if perform well during internship period.

Become a part of our Bluvec’s success story!  Apply now!

Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Dental care
 Extended health care
 On-site parking
 Paid time off
 Stock options
 Vision care

Flexible Language Requirement:

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 quality assurance: 1 year (preferred)

description:
Position: Marketing Co-op
Location: West Vancouver, BC, Canada
Duration: Four Months
Start Date: May 1st
About RentSimple:
RentSimple is an early-stage technology startup on a mission to improve the rental housing crisis. Our platform connects students, immigrants, and young professionals with our database of nearly 1,000,000 verified rental units. We are striving to make the search and leasing process seamless, transparent, and hassle-free. At RentSimple, we believe in creating value for both renters and property owners, using technology to simplify the rental experience.
Role Overview:
As a Marketing Co-op at RentSimple, you will be an integral part of our team, helping to form our brand and engage our target audience. Since we are very early stage, there will be opportunities to wear various hats from generating social content, helping design pitch decks, and manage our influencer relations.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development and execution of marketing campaigns across various social channels, specifically Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn.
Analyze market trends and competitor activities to provide actionable insights.
Support the organization and execution of promotional events and trade shows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales and product development, to align marketing strategies with company goals.
Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing initiatives, using data to drive decisions and improvements.
Engage with our community through social media channels, fostering positive relationships and feedback loops.
What RentSimple Offers:
Learn from our marketing advisors / influencers (total reach 17M).
iPhone + MacBook.
Hybrid if you like working from home or full access to our office.
Will come out of this co-op with an impressive marketing portfolio of work to point at.
Hands-on experience in a fast-growing startup environment.
Young and energetic team.
A collaborative, supportive, and fun team culture.
Not stuck in the office, we will be out viewing and filming high end rentals across BC.
Professional development and networking opportunities.
Opportunity to work on projects that directly impact the business.
Flexible hours.
Weekly team lunches.
How to Apply:
Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio/work samples to jack@rent-simple.com with the subject line "Marketing Co-op Application". In your cover letter, please explain why you are interested in working with RentSimple and how your skills and experiences make you a perfect fit for this role.
RentSimple is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Job Types: Seasonal, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 months
Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour
Expected hours: 35 per week
Benefits:

 Company events
 Discounted or free food
 On-site parking

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay

Education:

 Secondary School (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 West Vancouver, BC (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 West Vancouver, BC: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024-03-19Expected start date: 2024-05-01

description:
This position will incorpo
Responsibilities:
PRIMARY:

 OutSystems Development: Take primary responsibility for developing and enhancing a collaborative project built within the OutSystems platform, ensuring high-quality application performance and user experience.

SECONDARY:

 Data Analytics & Reporting: Work on bringing all our Power BI reporting up to modern standards. This includes creating insightful, dynamic reports and dashboards that support decision-making processes.
 Code Optimization: Refactor and optimize existing Python scripts and modules to improve efficiency, readability, and performance. Ensure code is well-documented and follows best practices.
 Data Analytics & Reporting: Optimizing Power BI data flows. This includes creating insightful, dynamic reports and dashboards that support decision-making processes.
 Collaboration & Learning: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide technical solutions. Participate in learning opportunities to stay updated with the latest technologies and best practices in software development and data analytics.
 Project Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation for all projects and modifications, ensuring transparency and ease of future enhancements.

Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
 Familiarity with the OutSystems development platform or a strong willingness to learn.
 Basic understanding of data visualization tools such as Power BI.
 Experience with Python programming and an interest in developing coding skills further.
 Proficiency in Excel, including formulas, pivot tables, and ideally VBA.
 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
 Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
 Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and adapting to changing environments.

What We Offer:

 Hands-on experience with real-world projects in a supportive and collaborative environment.
 Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to impactful solutions.
 Flexible work hours and remote work options to accommodate your study schedule.
 A pathway to professional growth and potential full-time opportunities post-internship.

How to Apply:
In your cover letter, highlight your interest in technology, any previous experience with OutSystems, Power BI, Python, or Excel, and what you hope to learn during your internship.
This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to gain hands-on experience in software development. As a Software Engineer Intern, you will have the chance to work on real-world projects and contribute to the success of our team. We offer a collaborative work environment, mentorship opportunities, and the chance to expand your skills in a professional setting. If you are passionate about software engineering and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply.

 Monday to Friday

 English (required)
