companyInfo/companyDescription:
Schneider’s purpose is to empower all to make the most of our energy and resources, bridging progress and sustainability for all. We call this Life Is On. 

Our mission is to be your digital partner for Sustainability and Efficiency. 

We drive digital transformation by integrating world-leading process and energy technologies, end-point to cloud connecting products, controls, software and services, across the entire lifecycle, enabling integrated company management, for homes, buildings, data centers, infrastructure and industries.

We are the most local of global companies. We are advocates of open standards and partnership ecosystems that are passionate about our shared Meaningful Purpose, Inclusive and Empowered values. 

- €25.7bn global revenue
- 137,000+ employees in 100+ countries
- 45% of revenue from IoT
- 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
description:
Description de poste: 
 
   Chez Schneider Electric, nous imaginons un monde où la plupart des maisons sont entièrement électriques, beaucoup plus intelligentes et où, au lieu de contribuer au changement climatique, elles aident à le limiter!
 
 
 
   Nous entendons par là une énergie solaire 100 % propre qui vous permet d'économiser de l'argent et vous protège de manière sans faille contre les pannes d'électricité. En ajoutant de l'intelligence à chaque prise de courant, appareil électroménager et douille d'éclairage de votre maison grâce à des algorithmes intelligents qui ajustent automatiquement votre consommation d'énergie. Éteignez la cuisinière si vous n'êtes pas sûr de l'avoir laissée allumée, mettez votre maison en mode "basse consommation" et ne laissez allumés que les appareils essentiels pour économiser de l'argent ou vous aider à surmonter une panne. Ne chargez votre véhicule électrique qu'à partir de vos panneaux solaires ou lorsque le réseau est le plus vert. Vous pouvez même alimenter votre maison à partir de votre voiture!
 
 
 
   Nous sommes en train de constituer un portefeuille de produits d'énergie domestique comprenant des onduleurs solaires, des batteries domestiques, des chargeurs de VE, des panneaux électriques intelligents, des prises de courant connectées et des solutions d'éclairage intelligentes qui fonctionnent ensemble pour rendre possible de nouvelles choses révolutionnaires à la maison. Le tout à partir de notre application!
 
 
 
   Rejoignez l'équipe qui nous fait entrer dans une nouvelle ère de maisons durables et intelligentes.
 
 
 
   https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCguiKomro2Ya2jsaN0Y60Nw
 
 
 
   Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un stagiaire en développement de logiciels embarqués pour rejoindre une équipe de développement qui construit des dispositifs de conversion d'énergie et des commutateurs industriels pour notre unité commerciale Solar and Storage. Le candidat retenu travaillera dans un environnement de développement de produits interfonctionnel composé d'équipes électriques, mécaniques, de fabrication, de tests de systèmes et d'autres équipes logicielles.
 
 
 
   Le poste proposé est pour un minimum de 8 mois.
 
 
 
   Que ferez-vous ?
 
 
   Travailler au sein d'une équipe scrum pour concevoir, mettre en œuvre et tester des micrologiciels embarqués pour des convertisseurs de puissance et des commutateurs industriels.
   Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes d'ingénierie transversales pour affiner, soutenir et livrer les micrologiciels.
   Vous travaillerez sur le cadre du micrologiciel intégré, l'environnement de test automatisé et les outils de développement personnalisés.
 
  
  (External) French Qualifications: 
 
   Quelles sont les qualifications qui vous permettront de réussir ? 
 
 
  Vous poursuivez actuellement des études en génie logiciel ou en génie électrique.
   Langage de programmation C/C++
   Python ou autre langage de script
   Familiarité avec : 
   
    RTOS embarqués (par exemple FreeRTOS, Micrium µC/OS, VXWorks, Neutrino).
     Écriture/débogage de pilotes de périphériques et de code d'initialisation du système.
     Diagrammes UML pour les séquences, les machines à états hiérarchiques et les flux de données.
     Normes de communication industrielle telles que IEC61850, Modbus, LIN bus, CANbus/J1939, DNP3 ou Ethernet/IP.
     Schémas de circuits imprimés et fiches techniques de dispositifs microélectroniques.
     Concepts de base des réseaux Linux et Windows.
     Machines virtuelles (VirtualBox ou VMWare).
   
   Création d'un plan de test et d'un environnement de test unitaire
  
   
     Connaissance fonctionnelle du français et de l'anglais afin de mieux collaborer avec nos équipes, nos clients et nos parties prenantes à l'échelle provinciale et internationale.
   
   Capacité à exceller dans un environnement de travail axé sur le travail d'équipe et les projets.
   Approche systématique et logique de la résolution de problèmes
   Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante, à prendre des initiatives et à respecter des délais serrés pour répondre aux besoins du projet.
 
 
 
   Permettez-nous de mieux vous connaître! Postulez dès aujourd’hui.
 
  
  (External) French Company Boiler Plate: 
 
   Pourquoi nous? 
 
 
  Schneider Electric est la référence en matière de transformation numérique de la gestion de l'énergie et de l'automatisation. Nos technologies permettent au monde d'utiliser l'énergie de manière sûre, efficace et durable. Nous nous efforçons de promouvoir une économie mondiale à la fois viable sur le plan écologique et hautement productive.
 
 
  34 milliards d'euros de chiffre d'affaires global 
 128 000+ employés dans plus de 100 pays 
 45 % du chiffre d'affaires de l'IoT 
 5 % du chiffre d'affaires consacré à la R&D
 
 
   
 
 
  Vous devez soumettre une demande en ligne pour que votre profil soit pris en considération pour un poste chez nous. Ce poste sera visible jusqu'à ce qu'il soit pourvu.
 
 
 
   Schneider Electric a pour politique de fournir des possibilités d'emploi et d'avancement égales dans les domaines du recrutement, de l'embauche, de la formation, du transfert et de la promotion de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelle que soit leur race, religion, couleur, sexe, handicap, origine nationale, ascendance, âge, statut militaire, orientation sexuelle, état matrimonial ou toute autre caractéristique ou conduite légalement protégée. Agences concernées : Schneider Electric n’accepte pas de curriculum vitæ soumis de façon spontanée et ne sera pas responsable des frais occasionnés par de tels envois.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un stagiaire en développement de logiciels embarqués pour rejoindre une équipe de développement qui construit des dispositifs de conversion d'énergie et des commutateurs industriels pour notre unité commerciale Solar and Storage. Le candidat retenu travaillera dans un environnement de développement de produits interfonctionnel composé d'équipes électriques, mécaniques, de fabrication, de tests de systèmes et d'autres équipes logicielles.

Le poste proposé est pour un minimum de 8 mois.

Que ferez-vous ?
  • Travailler au sein d'une équipe scrum pour concevoir, mettre en œuvre et tester des micrologiciels embarqués pour des convertisseurs de puissance et des commutateurs industriels.
  • Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes d'ingénierie transversales pour affiner, soutenir et livrer les micrologiciels.
  • Vous travaillerez sur le cadre du micrologiciel intégré, l'environnement de test automatisé et les outils de développement personnalisés.

(External) French Qualifications:
Quelles sont les qualifications qui vous permettront de réussir ?
  • Vous poursuivez actuellement des études en génie logiciel ou en génie électrique.
  • Langage de programmation C/C++
  • Python ou autre langage de script
  • Familiarité avec :
    • RTOS embarqués (par exemple FreeRTOS, Micrium µC/OS, VXWorks, Neutrino).
    • Écriture/débogage de pilotes de périphériques et de code d'initialisation du système.
    • Diagrammes UML pour les séquences, les machines à états hiérarchiques et les flux de données.
    • Normes de communication industrielle telles que IEC61850, Modbus, LIN bus, CANbus/J1939, DNP3 ou Ethernet/IP.
    • Schémas de circuits imprimés et fiches techniques de dispositifs microélectroniques.
    • Concepts de base des réseaux Linux et Windows.
    • Machines virtuelles (VirtualBox ou VMWare).
  • Création d'un plan de test et d'un environnement de test unitaire
  • Connaissance fonctionnelle du français et de l'anglais afin de mieux collaborer avec nos équipes, nos clients et nos parties prenantes à l'échelle provinciale et internationale.
  • Capacité à exceller dans un environnement de travail axé sur le travail d'équipe et les projets.
  • Approche systématique et logique de la résolution de problèmes
  • Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante, à prendre des initiatives et à respecter des délais serrés pour répondre aux besoins du projet.

Permettez-nous de mieux vous connaître! Postulez dès aujourd’hui.

(External) French Company Boiler Plate:
Pourquoi nous?
Schneider Electric est la référence en matière de transformation numérique de la gestion de l'énergie et de l'automatisation. Nos technologies permettent au monde d'utiliser l'énergie de manière sûre, efficace et durable. Nous nous efforçons de promouvoir une économie mondiale à la fois viable sur le plan écologique et hautement productive.


34 milliards d'euros de chiffre d'affaires global

128 000+ employés dans plus de 100 pays

45 % du chiffre d'affaires de l'IoT

5 % du chiffre d'affaires consacré à la R&D


Vous devez soumettre une demande en ligne pour que votre profil soit pris en considération pour un poste chez nous. Ce poste sera visible jusqu'à ce qu'il soit pourvu.

Schneider Electric a pour politique de fournir des possibilités d'emploi et d'avancement égales dans les domaines du recrutement, de l'embauche, de la formation, du transfert et de la promotion de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelle que soit leur race, religion, couleur, sexe, handicap, origine nationale, ascendance, âge, statut militaire, orientation sexuelle, état matrimonial ou toute autre caractéristique ou conduite légalement protégée. Agences concernées : Schneider Electric n’accepte pas de curriculum vitæ soumis de façon spontanée et ne sera pas responsable des frais occasionnés par de tels envois.
positionName: Stagiaire en developpement de logiciels embarqués

description:
Requisition ID: R022562
   
    Job Description:
    Front-End Developer Internship
    Demonware (Activision), Vancouver
    May 2024
   
    Interns will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.
   
    The Company 
   Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the world’s biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.
   
    We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!
   
    We’re open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!
   
    Big company challenges, small company culture
    Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected users. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Linux, MySQL, C++, and Erlang. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and interns have a huge impact on what we do. We’ve had interns produce code and have it running in production within the first three days of joining.
   
    The role:
    As a Front-End Developer Intern at Activision, you will work within the Experience Optimization group to build innovative and impactful websites. You’ll develop experience building responsive websites using HTML, Javascript and CSS.
   
    Key responsibilities include:
   
     Build, update, and maintain different types of websites including marketing (ex, callofduty.com) and corporate (ex, Activision.com).
     Build sites that can be authored by non-technical resources within the Activision CMS (Adobe AEM).
     Create reusable code for future use.
     Collaborate with website stakeholders, project managers, QA and UX/UI designers to ensure deliverables are met.
     Work in a collaborative environment with some pretty cool people.
   
   
    Requirements:
   
     Proficient with HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.
     Ability to use APIs to create dynamic websites.
     Able to create responsive websites without the use of libraries such as Bootstrap.
     Great organization skills and ability to work in a fast paced environment.
     Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
     Able to work independently with little oversight.
     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
     Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do.
   
   
    Perks 
   
    Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
     BBQs and Lunch & Learns
     City-center office location
     Vacation allowance
     Competitive pay
     Free games
   
    How to Apply
    You can apply directly through your Coop office or directly apply at demonware.net
   
    If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.
   
    We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply
   
    Rewards
    We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
   
     Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
     401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
     Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
     Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
     If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.
   
   
    Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.
    The standard base pay range for this role is $45,202.50 - $95,655.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.
descriptionHTML:
Requisition ID:

R022562

Job Description:

Front-End Developer Internship

Demonware (Activision), Vancouver

May 2024

Interns will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.

The Company

Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the world’s biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.

We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!

We’re open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!

Big company challenges, small company culture

Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected users. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Linux, MySQL, C++, and Erlang. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and interns have a huge impact on what we do. We’ve had interns produce code and have it running in production within the first three days of joining.

The role:

As a Front-End Developer Intern at Activision, you will work within the Experience Optimization group to build innovative and impactful websites. You’ll develop experience building responsive websites using HTML, Javascript and CSS.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Build, update, and maintain different types of websites including marketing (ex, callofduty.com) and corporate (ex, Activision.com).

  • Build sites that can be authored by non-technical resources within the Activision CMS (Adobe AEM).

  • Create reusable code for future use.

  • Collaborate with website stakeholders, project managers, QA and UX/UI designers to ensure deliverables are met.

  • Work in a collaborative environment with some pretty cool people.

Requirements:

  • Proficient with HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.

  • Ability to use APIs to create dynamic websites.

  • Able to create responsive websites without the use of libraries such as Bootstrap.

  • Great organization skills and ability to work in a fast paced environment.

  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.

  • Able to work independently with little oversight.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do.

Perks

  • Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen

  • BBQs and Lunch & Learns

  • City-center office location

  • Vacation allowance

  • Competitive pay

  • Free games

How to Apply

You can apply directly through your Coop office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply

Rewards

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:

  • Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
  • 401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
  • Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
  • Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
  • If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.

Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.

The standard base pay range for this role is $45,202.50 - $95,655.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company. QuadReal manages the real estate and mortgage programs of British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), one of Canada’s largest asset managers with a $153.4 billion portfolio. 

QuadReal manages a $37.6 billion portfolio spanning 23 Global Cities across 17 countries. The company seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.

QuadReal: Excellence lives here.
description:
About QuadReal Property Group
 
  QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management total $73.8 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating companies in which it holds an ownership interest.
 
  QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.
 
  QuadReal: Excellence lives here.
  www.quadreal.com
 
 
  
    We are committed to providing our Co-ops/Interns with a student experience that provides a supportive and engaging learning environment while developing skills and business acumen. Students will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of experiences including our Corporate Speaker Series, Fireside Chats, Volunteer opportunities and Networking events.
  
  
  
    Eligibility Note: To qualify for a student (Co-op/Internship) opportunity, students must be enrolled in their academic studies at a post-secondary institution (university/college) and must be returning to school after completion of their work term with QuadReal. If you are a student registered in an official co-op program at your post-secondary institution and completion of a final work term is a mandatory component for you to graduate, you are eligible to apply with the understanding that you will leave QuadReal at the end of your work term or have the possibility to be considered for full-time opportunities.
  
  
  
    Based in Vancouver, the Co-op/Intern, Marketing, will report to the Marketing Director, Oakridge Park, and be responsible for helping tell the Oakridge Park story by providing support to the marketing team in advance of the opening in 2025. The Marketing Intern will focus their attention on the overall execution of marketing activities designed to generate brand awareness, build community by increasing “heart share,” grow our digital footprint, and position Oakridge Park’s shopping centre as the leader in the luxe retail marketing space vis-à-vis cutting-edge marketing ideation and execution.
  
  
  
    What We Offer:
  
  
   
     An organization and leaders that support your development through meaningful work experience
     A Student Mentorship Program designed to provide 1:1 support throughout your experience
     Opportunities to build your industry knowledge through Corporate Speaker Series & Fireside Chats
     Giving back to community with your peers and team members through volunteering events
     Opportunities to build long lasting industry and professional relationships
   
  
  
  
    What You Will Experience:
  
  
   
     Exposure to the niche industry of retail luxury marketing
     Opportunity be part of one of North America’s largest mixed-use development’s marketing team
     Develop event management prowess from ideation to execution
     Increase knowledge in all facets of marketing including branding, content marketing, digital marketing, and communications
     Deepen understanding of customer journeys through digital marketing efforts such as social media, website traffic, etc
     Work cross-functionally with leasing and operations with hands on experience
     Assist the team with other duties as assigned
   
  
 
 
 
  
    What You’ll Bring:
  
  
   
     Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program that relates to marketing and communications
     Interest in developing a career in marketing with a passion for the fashion and retail industry
     Uncanny ability to multi-task with an exceptional eye for detail
     Collaborative team player and a self-starter
     Strong verbal and written communicator; fluency in Chinese (written) is considered to be an asset
     Intrinsically tech-savvy with social media tools and web analytics
     An appreciation for the luxury industry
     Agile with a can-do attitude
   
  
  
  
    Don’t have all of the above skills? Don’t worry. We still want to hear from you!
  
  
  
    The expected hourly range for this role is $22-$25.
  
 
  QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.
 
  Want to learn about our end-to-end recruitment process? Click this link for a short video that will take you through each step, so you’ll know exactly what to expect.

Don’t have all of the above skills? Don’t worry. We still want to hear from you!

Want to learn about our end-to-end recruitment process? Click this link for a short video that will take you through each step, so you’ll know exactly what to expect.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Founded in 1954, Beedie is an owner and developer of industrial, commercial and residential real estate. The company is the largest private industrial land owner, developer and property manager in Metro Vancouver, having completed more than 30 million SF of new construction throughout Metro Vancouver and Alberta. For over 65 years, Beedie has maintained a steadfast commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Their vertically integrated structure addresses all aspects of development, including land acquisition, design, construction, financing and property management. In 2011, the company launched Beedie Living to lead its large-scale residential and mixed-use projects, including several high profile developments currently underway in Metro Vancouver. The company prides itself on building quality projects and developing lasting relationships along the way.
description:
At Beedie, we foster talent, encourage innovation, and reward success.
 
 
 
   We’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team and share our passion for doing the best work of our lives. Our approach is simple: we work hard, we have fun, and we make a difference. And, we’ve been recognized as a top employer provincially and nationally. Our people are the heart and soul of our organization. If you are passionate, hardworking, ambitious, and want to be part of a dynamic and growing company that will take your career forward, join us.
 
 
 
   Position Overview
 
 
   We are seeking a summer intern to join our Interior Design team at Beedie. We are looking for a driven, energetic student who can work well in a collaborative team environment. The selected candidate will be assisting the interior design team. This opportunity will provide valuable insight into the overall design process from conception through to construction.
  
 Key Responsibilities
 
   Participate in design meetings to analyze plans and specifications for coordination, constructability
   Assist in producing preliminary floor plans for client review based on client requirements and in accordance with local codes and building code
   Assist in preparing detailed office improvement specifications and liaise with all teams as per the ID workflow process
   Assist with preparing and reviewing building permit drawings, issued for tender drawings as well as issued for construction drawings
   Sourcing current materials to update the interior design library
   Creating both digital and physical sample boards
   Assist in producing presentation quality 3d interior walkthroughs and renderings based on client’s floor plans and specifications
   Produce millwork elevations for custom office details including built-in’s and receptions desks for tendering purposes
   Coordinate the day to day design oriented activities
   Responsible for finish specifications and conducting market research to determine established standards within specific markets, specifying finish, plumbing, lighting and appliance packages for tenants and purchasers within established budgets
 
  Desired Skills and Experience
 
   Working towards a University degree or college diploma in a related field such as Interior Design
   Related work experience is an asset, including that of previous co-op placements, internships, projects
   Experience in the field of building construction is a definite asset but is not mandatory
   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
   Strong computer skills with a hands-on working knowledge of AutoCAD, Revit, 3d Studio Max or Sketchup is not mandatory but an asset
   Team player, energetic, resourceful, reliable, and timely
 
 
   Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)
 
 
 
   In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.
 
 
 
   We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
We make life easier for small and medium-sized businesses with AI-powered software. From automating invoices to supplying business insights, our technology removes friction for millions of people worldwide. With Sage, customers achieve more than they thought possible, and it’s because of our extraordinary colleagues who are redefining limits.

Innovation doesn't thrive in groupthink so if you've ever walked into a room and felt like you stood out, great. Us too. When you join Sage, you'll find people of all backgrounds, beliefs, looks, sounds, and ways of working. Because of that, we've gotten to where we are today and would never discriminate against it. If you need support applying, reach out to careers@sage.com.
description:
Job Description
  
  
    Are you interested in a career in product Marketing with a top employer? Do you want to gain practical, valuable skills from a global, FTSE 100 company? Would you like to spend the summer with the Sage team in our Richmond, BC office in this hybrid role? 
    
    Sage is seeking a Product Marketing Intern, MBA to roll up their sleeves and deep dive into competitive intelligence projects over the summer. Your research and insights will help drive competitive messaging and positioning for Sage Intacct. 
    
    The Sage Intacct MBA Internship program is your opportunity to make a tangible contribution to the continued success to the fastest growing product group at Sage, Sage Intacct. As a Product Marketing Intern, MBA you will help us develop compelling positioning, messaging, and sales enablement/sales tools. 
    
    Bring your passion along with curiosity, plus an eagerness to collaborate and innovate and you’ll find support to help you grow at every turn. You’ll work alongside experts that are at the top of their field, helping you gain a range of practical and technical skills to really develop your knowledge and experience.
  
 
  
 
  
    Key Responsibilities
  
  
    Key Responsibilities 
    
    Create, tune, or update product marketing collateral, website content, data sheets, case studies, white papers, and presentations 
    
    Assist with go-to-market execution, such as developing channel and direct sales tools, supporting training and enablement, and supporting marketing campaigns 
    
    Assist Product Marketing and Competitive Intelligence staff with additional projects, such as executing product launches and developing competitive messaging 
    
    What’s in it for you. 
    
    You'll get to expand your skills at a financially robust, global software company, contributing to products consistently rated #1 in customer satisfaction for 10 consecutive years. You will have the opportunity to learn from globally diverse, customer-centric marketing teams committed to being creative, bold, and effective. As a key contributor your work will give you the opportunity to contribute to the success of the team. Enjoy a working environment with values and behaviours you can be proud of (Human, Trust, Bold & Simplify. 
    
    What You’ll Appreciate About Your Team 
    
    You’ll be joining forces with a seasoned, inclusive, and supportive team of professionals. We pride ourselves on nurturing an environment of respect, mutual support, and open communication. You’ll thrive under the guidance of a leader celebrated for their supportive, trusting, and human-focused approach, transparent communication, commitment to knowledge sharing, and deep investment in each team member’s development. 
    
    Entry Requirements (These will help you thrive in the role) 
    
    Keen interest in Product Marketing. 
    
    Innovative and analytical mindset. 
    
    Adaptability and flexibility. 
    
    Teamworking and collaboration. 
    
    Desire to learn and make an impact. 
    
    Communication skills.
descriptionHTML:
Job Description
Are you interested in a career in product Marketing with a top employer? Do you want to gain practical, valuable skills from a global, FTSE 100 company? Would you like to spend the summer with the Sage team in our Richmond, BC office in this hybrid role?

Sage is seeking a Product Marketing Intern, MBA to roll up their sleeves and deep dive into competitive intelligence projects over the summer. Your research and insights will help drive competitive messaging and positioning for Sage Intacct.

The Sage Intacct MBA Internship program is your opportunity to make a tangible contribution to the continued success to the fastest growing product group at Sage, Sage Intacct. As a Product Marketing Intern, MBA you will help us develop compelling positioning, messaging, and sales enablement/sales tools.

Bring your passion along with curiosity, plus an eagerness to collaborate and innovate and you’ll find support to help you grow at every turn. You’ll work alongside experts that are at the top of their field, helping you gain a range of practical and technical skills to really develop your knowledge and experience.

Key Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities

Create, tune, or update product marketing collateral, website content, data sheets, case studies, white papers, and presentations

Assist with go-to-market execution, such as developing channel and direct sales tools, supporting training and enablement, and supporting marketing campaigns

Assist Product Marketing and Competitive Intelligence staff with additional projects, such as executing product launches and developing competitive messaging

What’s in it for you.

You'll get to expand your skills at a financially robust, global software company, contributing to products consistently rated #1 in customer satisfaction for 10 consecutive years. You will have the opportunity to learn from globally diverse, customer-centric marketing teams committed to being creative, bold, and effective. As a key contributor your work will give you the opportunity to contribute to the success of the team. Enjoy a working environment with values and behaviours you can be proud of (Human, Trust, Bold & Simplify.

What You’ll Appreciate About Your Team

You’ll be joining forces with a seasoned, inclusive, and supportive team of professionals. We pride ourselves on nurturing an environment of respect, mutual support, and open communication. You’ll thrive under the guidance of a leader celebrated for their supportive, trusting, and human-focused approach, transparent communication, commitment to knowledge sharing, and deep investment in each team member’s development.

Entry Requirements (These will help you thrive in the role)

Keen interest in Product Marketing.

Innovative and analytical mindset.

Adaptability and flexibility.

Teamworking and collaboration.

Desire to learn and make an impact.

Communication skills.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Founded in 1954, Beedie is an owner and developer of industrial, commercial and residential real estate. The company is the largest private industrial land owner, developer and property manager in Metro Vancouver, having completed more than 30 million SF of new construction throughout Metro Vancouver and Alberta. For over 65 years, Beedie has maintained a steadfast commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Their vertically integrated structure addresses all aspects of development, including land acquisition, design, construction, financing and property management. In 2011, the company launched Beedie Living to lead its large-scale residential and mixed-use projects, including several high profile developments currently underway in Metro Vancouver. The company prides itself on building quality projects and developing lasting relationships along the way.
description:
At Beedie, we foster talent, encourage innovation, and reward success.
 
 
 
   We’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team and share our passion for doing the best work of our lives. Our approach is simple: we work hard, we have fun, and we make a difference. And, we’ve been recognized as a top employer provincially and nationally. Our people are the heart and soul of our organization. If you are passionate, hardworking, ambitious, and want to be part of a dynamic and growing company that will take your career forward, join us.
 
 
 
   Position Overview
 
 
   We are seeking a summer intern to join our Health and Safety team at Beedie. We are looking for a driven, energetic student who can work well in a collaborative team environment. This opportunity will provide valuable insight into the overall Health and Safety dynamic across all stages of the industrial construction process.
  
 Key Responsibilities
 
   Aid in organizing and developing of Safety Reports 
  Assist in updates to the Health and Safety Program, Policies and Procedures
   Assist with completion of COR Audit Action plans
   Complete monthly safety statistics and injury report
   Assist in reporting incidents/accidents, investigations, root cause analysis and submitting reports as required
   Assist in the coordination of safety training and orientation programs
   Review and follow-up on corrective measures including recommendations of the JOSH committee
   Order safety supplies as require
   Support CSO’s in assigned project‐based work and accompany them on inspections and complete on own as required
   Provide site coverage where needed
   Help with Safety administration of documents. (meeting minutes, statistics, etc.)
 
 
 
   Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)
 
 
 
   In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.
 
 
 
   We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
SAP is one of the world’s leading producers of software for business process management. Today, SAP has over 250 million cloud users and more than 100 solutions covering all industries and business functions.

Every day, we help companies and organizations of all sizes and industries to run their businesses profitably, to adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
description:
We help the world run better
 
  Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
  About the SAP Internship Experience Program
 
  The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.
 
  Three reasons to intern at SAP
 
 
   Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
   Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
   Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
 
 
  About the team
 
  SAP’s Global Value Advisory (GVA), a key component of SAP’s Industries & Customer Advisory (ICA) group, is focused on supporting SAP customers and the 600 SAP Value Advisors across our regions as they conduct collaborative value-based customer engagements.
 
  The VA team has been a competitive differentiator for SAP for almost two decades and continues to play a leading role in setting industry-leading value-selling practices in the technology industry. The team supports tip of the spear engagements across the globe hand in hand with the regions. The Global VA team is responsible for developing thought leadership content, value-based tools, customer engagement methodology and enablement for the field, and provides support for strategic customer engagements to help articulate the business value customers can achieve with SAP innovations.
  We strive to achieve customer success and advance SAP’s strategic agenda across all lines of business spanning 25 industries.
 
  What you’ll do
 
  Position Title: SAP iXp - Customer Engagement Innovation Location: Vancouver, BC Expected start date to end date: March-April 2024 (6 months)
 
  In this role you'll
 
  This position will report to the Global VP of Customer Engagements and Innovation and is focused on three key areas.
 
  Customer Engagements:
 
  Support customer engagements in collaborations with global engagement managers, regional practitioners, account teams, and external stakeholders.
  
 Solicit field feedback on requirements and opportunities to improve how we engage with SAP customers in value-focused engagements. Translate requirements into engagement methodology, tools, and projects that help scale value advisory.
 
  Champion the development of original thought leadership and concrete value add from own engagement experiences or by capturing the same from the field
 
  Methodology:
 
  Own the Customer Value Journey and ensure its execution in customer engagements w/ focus on results achieved and customer outputs driven.
 
  Design and scale and VA model that supports volume with velocity.
 
  Work with the Global VA functions to ensure the successful roll out of new programs at a Regional / MU level.
 
  Act as a conduit between the Global VA team and select Regions to ensure best practice sharing and adoption.
 
  Innovation:
 
  Identify key industry trends and changing industry dynamics to evolve SAP VA consultative selling practices, ensure on-going relevance and continued VA leadership position in the industry.
 
  Identify new ways to engage with customers to support their journey with value and business transformation at the center. Pilot and scale those initiatives efficiently and rollout based on pilot results.
 
  
 Role requirements
  
 
 
   Track record of top performance and continuously executing on best-in-class consulting or analytical engagements in investment banking, consulting, educational environments, or similar.
   Excellent communication skills that translate to design awareness of Powerpoint and Excel
   Hypothesis and data-driven mindset to make analytical decisions for the customer and the VA field.
   Ability to lead cross-functional, global teams for successful project execution with ability to motivate and influence individuals beyond direct field of control.
   Ability to take complex topics and synthesize into clear, concise executive summaries. Support, develop and deliver presentations to senior customer and SAP leadership teams
   Ability to work in virtual set-ups with 10-20% travel requirements when travelling is safe.
   Excellent written oral, and presentation skills in English is mandatory
 
 
  #LI-Hybrid
 
  We build breakthroughs together
 
  SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
 
  We win with inclusion
 
  SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world. SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
  For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
 
  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
 
  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
  SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the hourly base salary rate range applicable for the posted role. The targeted range for this position is 18.00 - 36.00 CAD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidates will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. SAP offers limited benefits for employees hired into hourly or like roles subject to appliable plan/policy terms. A summary of benefits and eligibility requirements can be found by clicking this link: SAPNorthAmericaBenefits.com
  Requisition ID: 384818 | Work Area: Administration | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Intern | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid

companyInfo/companyDescription: Founded in 1954, Beedie is an owner and developer of industrial, commercial and residential real estate. The company is the largest private industrial land owner, developer and property manager in Metro Vancouver, having completed more than 30 million SF of new construction throughout Metro Vancouver and Alberta. For over 65 years, Beedie has maintained a steadfast commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Their vertically integrated structure addresses all aspects of development, including land acquisition, design, construction, financing and property management. In 2011, the company launched Beedie Living to lead its large-scale residential and mixed-use projects, including several high profile developments currently underway in Metro Vancouver. The company prides itself on building quality projects and developing lasting relationships along the way.
description:
At Beedie, we foster talent, encourage innovation, and reward success.
 
 
 
   We’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team and share our passion for doing the best work of our lives. Our approach is simple: we work hard, we have fun, and we make a difference. And, we’ve been recognized as a top employer provincially and nationally. Our people are the heart and soul of our organization. If you are passionate, hardworking, ambitious, and want to be part of a dynamic and growing company that will take your career forward, join us.
 
 
 
   Position Overview
 
 
   We are seeking a summer intern to join our Industrial Development team at Beedie. We are looking for a driven, energetic student who can work well in a collaborative team environment. The selected candidate will be assisting our development team with a number of projects in various stages of the development process. This opportunity will provide valuable insight into the overall industrial development life cycle and will be foundational to a career in development.
 
  
  
  Key Responsibilities
 
   Provide support to Beedie’s Development Team by assisting with: 
  Creating and reviewing project budgets
   Creating and reviewing project schedules
   Reviewing City bylaws (Official Community Plans, Zoning etc.) and provide commentary on the impacts to specific development projects. 
  Reviewing Design Drawings (ex. Architectural, Landscape and Civil etc.) 
  Coordination of Internal/External Meetings and taking meeting minutes
 
  Desired Skills and Experience
 
   Working towards a University degree or college diploma in finance, planning, enginnering or real estate. 
  Related work experience is an asset, including that of previous co-op placements, internships, projects.
   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
   Strong computer skills with a hands-on working knowledge of MS office platforms, particularly Teams, SharePoint, Planner, Excel and Word.
   Team player, energetic, resourceful, reliable, and timely.
   Eager to work and learn in a fast-paced industry. 
  Comfortable working in a professional office setting with some travel to municipalities or job sites.
 
 
 
   Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)
 
 
 
   In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.
 
 
 
   We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

For over 65 years, Beedie has maintained a steadfast commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Their vertically integrated structure addresses all aspects of development, including land acquisition, design, construction, financing and property management. description:
At Beedie, we foster talent, encourage innovation, and reward success.
 
 
 
   We’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team and share our passion for doing the best work of our lives. Our approach is simple: we work hard, we have fun, and we make a difference. And, we’ve been recognized as a top employer provincially and nationally. Our people are the heart and soul of our organization. If you are passionate, hardworking, ambitious, and want to be part of a dynamic and growing company that will take your career forward, join us.
 
 
 
   Position Overview
 
 
   We are seeking a summer intern to join our Industrial Project Management team at Beedie. We are looking for a driven, energetic student who can work well in a collaborative team environment. The selected candidate will be assisting multiple project teams at various stages of their respective projects. This opportunity will provide valuable insight into the overall project management dynamic across all stages of the industrial construction process.
  
 Key Responsibilities
 
   Play a supporting role for our project coordinator and project management teams on industrial construction projects
   Coordinate the exchange of information between multiple team members such as subcontractors, project design team, internal construction team and general contractors
   Assist in the review of design documentation and drawings for various disciplines such as the architect, project engineers and consultants — analysis of the proposed design with the progress of on-site construction on various job sites
   Working closely with the project team to facilitate the procurement of materials, design documentation from suppliers and subcontractors
   Participate in meetings with various parties to ensure the communication is documented concisely and accurately
   Assist the project team in tendering and procurement of numerous scopes associated with the current stage of their respective projects
   Assist the project team in maintaining and reporting on tracking logs required for monitoring items such as RFI’s, procurement, and subcontracts
   Assist in the obtainment, review, maintenance and approval of shop drawings and related documents
   Assist field site staff with site coordination, tracking, site conditions and verifying RFI’s
 
  Desired Skills and Experience
 
   Working towards a University degree or college diploma in a related field such as civil engineering, building construction, or construction management.
   Related work experience is an asset, including that of previous co-op placements, internships, projects.
   Experience in the field of building construction is a definite asset but is not mandatory. 
  Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
   Strong computer skills with a hands-on working knowledge of MS office platforms, particularly Excel and Word with additional familiarity in beneficial software like Procore and Bluebeam.
   Team player, energetic, resourceful, reliable, and timely.
   Eager to work and learn in a fast-paced industry. 
  Comfortable working in a professional office setting and travelling locally to job sites
 
 
 
   Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)
 
 
 
   In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.
 
 
 
   We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

  • Strong computer skills with a hands-on working knowledge of MS office platforms, particularly Excel and Word with additional familiarity in beneficial software like Procore and Bluebeam.
  • Team player, energetic, resourceful, reliable, and timely.
  • Eager to work and learn in a fast-paced industry.
  • Comfortable working in a professional office setting and travelling locally to job sites

Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)

In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.

We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

description:
As a Biomaterials Scientist Co-op you will be part of a multidisciplinary R&D team focused on development of 3D human tissues for in vitro drug testing or as life-changing, cell-based implantable tissue therapeutics. In this role, you will provide support for the design, manufacturing, and testing of 3D human tissues for pre-clinical use or as therapeutic devices by using and adapting Aspect’s microfluidic bioprinting technology. This is an exciting opportunity for you to work closely with a team of engineers, cell biologists, and biomaterials experts, to develop bioprinted tissues that could transform the way we develop medicines and treat disease.
  
 Responsibilities
 
   Support development and functionalization of synthetic or natural polymers that support therapeutic cell function and tissue transplant suitability. 
  Formulate and characterize bioinks, buffers and solutions to use in bioprinting processes for therapeutic applications.
   Execute assays to characterize biomaterial formulations for physicochemical properties, printability, biological function, stability, and toxicity. 
  Execute morphometric, mechanical, and stability tests to characterize bioprinted hydrogels.
   Create experimental reports and present experiments to key stakeholders.
   Rigorously document all work, following good documentation practice. 
  Become an expert user of Aspect’s microfluidic bioprinting technology.
 
  Qualifications
 
   Education: Student enrolled in biomedical engineering, polymer chemistry, chemical engineering or similar program. 
  Professional Experience: Demonstrated experience in designing and executing research experiments in a lab setting. Conducted technical literature searches to support research experiments with full understanding of the research and development process.
   Biomaterials Experience: You understand and know how to manipulate formulations. You have a passion for biomaterials, tissue engineering, or therapeutic tissue applications. Experience with 3D bioprinting would be preferred. 
  Problem Solver: Demonstrated ability to identify innovative working solutions to problems with challenging constraints.
   Effective Communicator: You have superior written and verbal communication skills. You are an active listener who can communicate to different audiences in diverse situations.
   Detail oriented: You have outstanding attention to detail, and experimental and process rigor. You take pride in your work and strive for excellence in the work you do.
   Go-Getter: You work with a sense of urgency, are results-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced, interdisciplinary, and entrepreneurial environment. You are willing to roll up your sleeves and do what it takes to get the job done.
 
 
 
   The hiring range for this role is $3,000 - $4,000 per month. Our ranges are based on market data and offered salaries will be based on a combination of factors including, but not limited to, the successful candidate’s job-related knowledge, skills, education, and experience.
 
 
   Who We Are
 
 
   Aspect Biosystems is a Canadian biotechnology company creating bioprinted tissue therapeutics to transform how we treat disease. Our bold team of innovators and entrepreneurs have joined us from all over the globe to create a new class of regenerative medicine and work towards a future where our bioprinted tissues are used to save lives and make people healthier. We are endlessly curious and wildly passionate about what we do. Every person on our team is a key contributor to our success and is eager to roll up their sleeves to make a difference in the ever-changing world of biotech. If you are committed to making a real impact and accelerating the development of life-changing therapies, we want to hear from you!
 
 
 
   At Aspect Biosystems, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or terminate, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, provincial, or local law.

description:
We are seeking a Laboratory Operations Co-op to join our talented team of researchers in the discovery of bioprinted therapeutics. You will be a vital part of our lab
 
 
   operations and perform all lab support duties, including, but not limited to, supply management, laboratory cleaning, and providing lab services.
  
 Responsibilities
 
   Perform routine lab tasks such as glass washing, autoclaving, gas monitoring and hazardous waste disposal.
   Replenish and maintain stock levels of lab consumables and report any shortages to your manager in a timely manner.
   Carry out inventory for chemicals, reagents, and supplies.
   Assist in maintaining common equipment such as refrigerators, freezers, biological safety cabinets and incubators and report any issues promptly.
   Keep all electronic files, paperwork and notebooks up to date and in good order.
   Prepare commonly used reagents as requested.
   Help keep lab work areas clean and tidy
   Support lab teams with other duties as needed.
 
  Qualifications
 
   Education: Enrolled in a college or university science related course. Some practical hands-on lab experience preferred.
   Detail-Oriented: You have outstanding attention to detail and experimental and process rigour. You take pride in your work and strive for excellence.
   Intellectually Curious: You have a burning desire to learn more and aren’t afraid to ask questions.
   Collaborative: You thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment and believe that we can get further, faster by working together.
 
 
 
   The hiring range for this role is $3,000 - $4,000 per month. Our ranges are based on market data and offered salaries will be based on a combination of factors including, but not limited to, the successful candidate’s job-related knowledge, skills, education, and experience.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Public relations firm Hill & Knowlton has ridden its reputation as a straight-shooter straight to the top. The company (whose founder John W. Hill emphasized the importance of dealing honestly and openly with the press) is one of the largest PR firms in the US and a part of advertising conglomerate WPP Group. Hill & Knowlton's services range from marketing communications to corporate reputation management to political lobbying. With almost 80 offices spanning some 45 countries, it caters to the technology and health industries; Lobbying firm Wexler & Walker Public Policy Associates and Finnish unit Hill and Knowlton Finland Oy act as subsidiaries for Hill & Knowlton.

In early 2011, WPP officially merged Hill & Knowlton with Texas-based Public Strategies, another PR consultancy it owned. Public Strategies has more than a dozen offices in the US and Mexico. The deal gave Hill & Knowlton a more significant presence in the important US market and enhanced its expertise in the public affairs, research, and financial sectors. Each company retained its brand identity after the merger.

The agency has been focused on expanding into China. In early 2008, Hill & Knowlton bought a 70% stake in Rikes Communications, a PR firm based in Hong Kong. The deal brought a sizeable amount of Chinese clients to Hill & Knowlton's customer base. The agency also acquired a majority interest in Synergy, its South Korean partner. In mid-2009, Hill & Knowlton added to its operations in Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou when it launched an office in Chengdu, a major city in western China that the agency considers to be a region ripe for economic growth.

During that same time period, the company expanded its presence into Africa, another region the firm considers an emerging market, by establishing a joint venture with holding company Scangroup Limited. The joint venture, Hill & Knowlton East Africa Ltd, offers public relations expertise throughout Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania.

Hill & Knowlton was acquired by WPP Group in 1987 through the purchase of J. Walter Thompson (now JWT). Hill & Knowlton was founded in 1927.
description:
About Hill & Knowlton 
 Hill & Knowlton is the global strategic communications leader for transformation. We help brands, businesses, and leaders build reputation, manage risk, and create breakthrough opportunities for growth. Founded in 1927, today's Hill & Knowlton operates 70 offices in over 30 countries, providing advisory, public relations and creative solutions to local and global clients. Our global team offers integrated strategic services grounded in deep sector expertise and enabled by creativity and intelligence. Headquartered in New York, Hill & Knowlton is part of WPP, one of the world's largest communications services groups. 
  Are you looking to kick start your career in Communications and Public Affairs by working with some of the smartest, most creative minds in the business? Hill & Knowlton is looking for a passionate, driven, digitally savvy Intern to join our team in British Columbia. The successful candidate would be part of our team working with clients from a range of sectors, including healthcare, energy & industrials, financial services, technology, and much more. 
  Our internships are designed to give you hands-on experience working in an agency setting. You'll have the chance to work on client files, access senior talent, and participate in internal training programs. 
  In this role, the Intern will be responsible mainly for traditional and social media monitoring, public affairs and government monitoring and reporting, media relations, stakeholder research projects, creating and editing content, and providing support to the team on various client programs. 
  Duties & Responsibilities: 
  
  Monitors traditional and social media using Cision, Meltwater, Factiva, Eureka, and other sources and prepares reports using customized tools for clients 
  Tracks public affairs developments at the provincial government level including monitoring Question Periods, legislative proceedings, government policy, and political staffing changes 
  Drafts a wide range of written materials (press releases, articles, media and executive briefing documents, government correspondence, social media content, and coverage reports) 
  Assists in the coordination of client events (news conferences, media briefings, analyst meetings, media tours, and the like) 
  Build and develop social and content engagement plans to build community and public support for client initiatives 
  Develop social content in coordination with creative teams to build a presence for client and client issues, including writing long and short form content, editing videos, and designing graphics 
  Develop digital ad buys in coordination with senior paid media specialists 
  Support social and content strategies in public and corporate affairs as well as consumer communications settings 
  Measure and optimize content, to ensure we are creating content with impact 
  Research client and competitor products and services 
  Serves as a reliable team member and provides support to peers and clients 
  Completes work product, timesheets, and billing reports accurately and in accordance with deadlines 
  Proactively works with supervisor to establish and track career goals, training, and skill-building needs 
  Exemplifies the company's ethics, vision, and values in daily work 
  Provides sound judgment and problem-solving skills 
  Proactively seeks and shares relevant information with colleagues and clients 
  
 Qualifications & Skills: 
  
  Previous PR Internship or relevant leadership role at college/university or in a government/political environment 
  Excellent communication, organizational, and writing skills 
  Knowledge of BC's political and media landscapes 
  Technical savvy and a strong interest in the latest social and content trends 
  Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a dynamic, creative, and fast-paced environment 
  Ability to work well with others and independently as needed 
  Positive attitude with a proactive approach 
  Required proficiency with Microsoft Office, social media; PR & media monitoring software (Cision, Meltwater, Factiva, Eureka) a plus 
  
 The base annual salary for this position at the time of this posting is C$34,944 with a 4% vacation pay on a pro-rated basis for the duration of your intenrship. 
  Hill+KnowltonStrategies is dedicated to employment equity, welcomes diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from all qualified applicants. If you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please reach out to us.  We thank all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. 
  Hill & Knowlton is more than an agency. It's a collection of thousands of brilliant, collaborative and driven employees – all united around a single vision of transforming our clients, our company and the world.  Across 70 offices in 30 countries our people are the heartbeat of our business. Bridging countless cultures, backgrounds and lived experiences, we are drawn together by a common drive and a collaborative spirit – called to our craft each day by the desire to deliver the best work.  And at H&K, diversity, equity and inclusion are not just values; they are strategic imperatives that fuel our future in an industry built on the art of understanding, connecting and developing relationships. We believe that a diverse workforce is essential for inspiring bold ideas, fostering constructive dialogue and cultivating meaningful experiences that drive innovation and creativity. 
  When you click the "Submit Application" button below, this will send any information you add below to Hill & Knowlton. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

positionName: Intern, Integrated Communications & Public Affairs – Vancouver

companyInfo/companyDescription: Founded in 1954, Beedie is an owner and developer of industrial, commercial and residential real estate. The company is the largest private industrial land owner, developer and property manager in Metro Vancouver, having completed more than 30 million SF of new construction throughout Metro Vancouver and Alberta. For over 65 years, Beedie has maintained a steadfast commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Their vertically integrated structure addresses all aspects of development, including land acquisition, design, construction, financing and property management. In 2011, the company launched Beedie Living to lead its large-scale residential and mixed-use projects, including several high profile developments currently underway in Metro Vancouver. The company prides itself on building quality projects and developing lasting relationships along the way.
description:
At Beedie, we foster talent, encourage innovation, and reward success.
 
 
 
   We’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team and share our passion for doing the best work of our lives. Our approach is simple: we work hard, we have fun, and we make a difference. And, we’ve been recognized as a top employer provincially and nationally. Our people are the heart and soul of our organization. If you are passionate, hardworking, ambitious, and want to be part of a dynamic and growing company that will take your career forward, join us.
 
 
 
   Position Overview
 
 
   We are seeking a summer intern to join our Development team at Beedie Living. We are looking for a driven, energetic student who can work well in a collaborative and fast-paced team environment. As the Development Intern you will have the opportunity to gain experience across several different components of the project life cycle foundational to a career in development. The Development Intern will work closely with members of the Development team to advance projects towards approvals while gaining exposure to a variety of exciting project types.
  
 Key Responsibilities
 
   Coordinating the entitlement process with municipalities by obtaining information, assisting with permit applications, and monitoring progress
   Preparing presentations as required to advance the development process
   Communicating and working with outside consultants for development projects
   Communicating and working with other departments to complete assigned tasks.
   Coordinate exchange of information across internal departments 
  Communicating key project updates through thoughtful materials, minutes and other reporting
   Undertake research and analysis projects centered around key aspects of the development process including market data, municipal policies, and emerging areas of opportunity
   Assist in building and analyzing project proformas, cashflows and financial reporting related to active projects and current acquisitions
   Collaborate directly with various members of the Development team to implement or evolve systems for standardization across projects
   Supporting the Development Team and other Beedie Living departments a needed
   Track Council updates and progression of relevant projects/policies and provide updates to the Development Team.
   Use municipal GIS tools to obtain zoning and property information and review information for any property restrictions or encumbrances.
   Manage and track consultant deliverables including, design plans, legal surveys, landscape and civil drawing packages, and due diligence documents.
 
  Desired Skills and Experience
 
   Working towards a University degree or college diploma in business, urban geography, architecture, engineering, planning or real estate.
   Related work experience is an asset, including that of previous co-op placements, internships, projects.
   Appetite for learning and growing your skill set in a fast-paced environment
   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
   Strong computer skills with a hands-on working knowledge of MS office platforms, particularly Teams, SharePoint, Planner, Excel and Word.
   Team player, energetic, resourceful, reliable, and timely, with a strong ability to self-prioritize and take initiative
   Comfortable working in a professional office setting with some travel to municipalities or job sites.
 
 
 
   Your annual salary will be $46,800 ($24/per hour)
 
 
 
   In-person interviews will be conducted from February 20th - 27th in our Burnaby head office.
 
 
 
   We value your interest in Beedie. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.
